XuD20cbEoHEB-C0GzgLHjw.text: It's a Japanese fast food. I'm very impressed with the service, the owner spent some times to greet everyone. I ordered beef bowl teriyaki but the beef teriyaki is a lil bit over cooked and the smell of the burning beef just overwhelmed me. The Panko breaded fish plate is the one that I recommend to try. They also have the seaweed salad which I found good. And they also charged for the soda refill $.30

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Fin - Phoenix, AZ, United States

eUKPMR8m8vAtL1hulfDW2A.text: The Blue Fin is a place I have probably driven by 100 times, either coming/going to work or heading to the library. I didn't even realize it was actually open until I got onto Yelp and saw some reviews. So close to my office, I had to try it out.....on a Sunday when it was closed. Oops. Let's try this again, for lunch  The place ain't big, so make sure you get there early, especially if you have more than 4 people. I also noticed they had their iced tea and lemonade in massive buckets, which is the ONLY way to serve beverages in my humble opinion. Quite like a lot of places in the area, the Blue Fin has a massive amount of pictures of their food up on the wall, so it does make choosing a meal that much more easy. A quick moving line and a 5 minute wait later, I had my teriyaki chicken bowl and was back to the office.  First off, this is a pretty big meal for the price. It's a great lunch option for what you pay for. Having said that, it's not great. The rice was a little over-cooked, which I actually like, but some people may be put off by, especially with how sticky it was. The chicken itself was good, but also had been either cooked or sat under a heat lamp for too long. Damn the salmonella, I want my chicken cooked just enough to stop clucking!! The sauce was very good though, and really brought the meal together.  Overall, it's a solid place for the price. I wouldn't go out of my way to go there when I am not downtown, but I am sure to head back during a busy lunch hour. Worth the visit

7g84hFrBvuAC_4TKh-A_Rg.text: Went there twice this week alone.   Service is great, the owner actually thanked us for our business and was really helpful when trying to order. Cucumber salad was great both times. Went with a group of 3 today and had to sit outside because there are only 2 tables that hold more than 2 people inside.  Great place to eat, I'd go back.

Dm9DHuIQEjY0r5D1ABapAw.text: Ok, I don't usually go too deep into my personal life but this place brings back good memories. My fiancee at the time (whom I've been married to for 15 years now) took me to this place one afternoon. He worked in the downtown area so he was familiar with all the good eats. Surprisingly our food was great. As the years roll by, I take our kids and we sit at the same spot that my husband and I sat during our date 15 years ago. We order the same entree too, lol. This place has several entrees to choose from. My favorite is the Teriyaki Chicken. I know it sounds plain but don't judge a book by it's cover. It's a small hole in the wall but it's clean and not run down. The owners have maintained the business very well. Go to their website for a complete listing of their entrees. By the way, try the Mochi dessert. I don't know whats in it but I LIKE IT ALOT...

_2zYEfSqufQMcpaijztOIQ.text: The Teriyaki Beef Bowl & the fried dumplings (Gyoza) are very good and very reasonably priced. The Panko Fish is also quite tasty, but I've had better fish at other nearby places (like Karim's) so I wouldn't bother to go to Blue Fin for fish. I've also had the Chicken Teriyaki Bowl before, but didn't find it too tasty. Coworkers have commented to me that the other chicken dishes are not to their liking, so perhaps this is a weak point for them.    Your best bet is to pick the food up to go as the inside is very small (and not aesthetically pleasing) and the place gets quite busy during lunch time. The food here is decent and the food reasonably cheap so we keep going back, but it's not really high on my list of preferred Asian places.   P.S. This place seems to attract a lot of Phoenix's redneck population (though I don't know why), so just be prepared if that sort of thing puts you off!

YHzs-DVLlLSjAXsa3oLaxw.text: Love the owners and workers at The Blue Fin.  Very friendly and always happy and smiling. That kind of customer service almost always makes any experience 100% better. Plus, they've got great food too.  My usual choice is either the Teriyaki Chicken Bowl or their eight piece California rolls and Miso Soup. All great, affordable and fast. It can get pretty busy there, so it is nice that you can call in your order ahead of time, and pick it up at walk-up/drive-through window.    The Blue Fin is a little out of the way from where I work, but it is always a treat when I order out. And of course, being greeted with a warm smile and a friendly "hello" is also a big plus in my book.

-CtM_ZYajEemqbWTts31vQ.text: Yay for me, they open at 10:30am.  Service quick and helpful. Owner (I think) was present and seemed to know quite a few of the regulars. I had the panko chicken with an egg roll. Both were simple, yet above average. Quite a selection for such a small place.  All of the items I saw were pretty big or almost too big for a single serving.  Prices are a buck or two more than you might pay for at your average rice bowl shop, but it's worth it.  I'll be back. Soon.

7HeYuKtpyP3AhroKhJJNEw.text: Sounds of stirring, lunch nears and my appetite waits my neighbor enters.  Quick we drive to it A simple place but look-busy! Still no wait to sit.  Varied menu greets us I choose the daily special Food like its home-made.  Service is friendly. Order comes quickly to you, Owners always smile.  Soon it's time to go my thoughts turn food away, but look my wallet not empty.

84yToYp79MVtuH5GQJZLqQ.text: 1 Star: Being greeted by the sweetest, wittiest older Japanese woman upon entering  1 Star:  Every photo of every menu item on the wall makes you want to order them all  1 Star:  Wonderful sticky rice, imported Panko and grain fed Chicken  1 Star:  The clientele of firemen, business types and hipsters lets you know this is a local joint  1 Star:  The older lady saying, "Excuse my Boarding School reach," when she grabs your tea to refill for the 3rd time.  This is delicious, low cost Japanese comfort food.  Teriyaki, Panko Fish, Sushi, Japanese Curry.  Delicious.

p2OxXzO0u_L-euWBsVuYvQ.text: Since I love sushi and have been eating all varieties of Asian food since high school, I tend to avoid ordering teriyaki dishes when I go to Japanese restaurants. Not only do I find the teriyaki sauce that Japanese places typically use to be too sweet, but there is always so much - sushi, edamame, seaweed salads - at good Japanese places that I would rather spend my money on and fill my stomach with. Going forward, Blue Fin will be an exception to this no-teriyaki rule of mine. In fact, I may even go there *because* of the teriyaki.   My husband and I stopped in for lunch. We both ordered the teriyaki combos (served with salad and rice) - he got beef and I got the white-meat chicken. Both were priced around $6. The food took a while to come out, and there were no seats left inside, so we had to sit outside, but the owner/manager was super nice, offering to re-seat us inside when tables became available and to bring us our food when it was ready.   When she brought our plates, we were shocked at how huge the portions were. Yes, there was tons of salad (with a delicious sesame dressing) and white rice, but there was also a *lot* of meat. My husband and I believe ourselves to have larger-than-average appetites, but we could barely finish one plate and vowed to split one next time. So, the portions were huge, but the teriyaki flavor was also amazing. It was subtle and flavorful but not too sweet, serving to bring out the flavor of the meat and not just provide a sticky and overwhelming glaze. The black sesame seeds and spicy powder they put on the table were nice add-ons but weren't even necessary since the sauce was so flavorful. I am, however, docking The Blue Fin a star because the quality of my husband's beef wasn't as high as that of the chicken; it was fatty and hard to chew.   After years of avoiding teriyaki, The Blue Fin makes me actually crave it. Plus, it's affordable and has a super-friendly staff. I will definitely be back.

db0aw_f182KvVNfLuMHhAw.text: Small.  Great food.  Great price,  exceptional staff.  If your downtown,  try this place.  The servings are good sized and the quality is hard to beat.  Fresh taste.  Will be back.

P7r5nI2OQWXiunVNnWkE6Q.text: I had a pretty good lunch experience here the other day.  Very friendly staff, the place was quite busy and all the ladies were running food and drinks out to customers but everyone still had a smile on their face. Great deal too, for less than eight bucks you can get the lunch special with salad, two mini egg rolls, chicken and rice and the portions are enormous.  I probably finished about half and I was stuffed!  Good food too the sweet & salty teriyaki was nicely complimented by a char-grill smokiness.  I look forward to my next visit!

Yye-61OWH7jCsO_r2mjIxw.text: I'm half Japanese and have had a very difficult time finding good authentic Japanese food in the Phoenix area.  I am so impressed with this little restaurant!  The customer service is awesome.  The owner walked around talking to people and refilling drinks, getting to go boxes, and generally made sure everyone had everything they needed.  Top that off with some majorly delicious Japanese food, and that's The Blue Fin.  I had the Katsu Pork and I have to tell ya, it's just like my mother's.  Their food is made fresh and their sushi is made daily.  It's made the old fashioned Japanese way, not like the kind you get at Fry's Grocery Store.  Their prices are also very reasonable.  I can't wait to go back for the third time to try some other dishes.  Hmmm...maybe the yakisoba...

3JLamS8WHWuRLRUrut9z1w.text: At lunch today I wanted sushi. Looked on Yelp for somewhere close. Found The Blue Fin. Read the reviews and decided to see how it was. With the light rail going down Central, if you are not on the right side of the road you have to go about a quarter of a mile to turn around. Traffic was light so no problem. Painted blue and white. Very bright colors shows up well. Gives you the welcome feel. It not really a sushi bar. They specialize in teriyaki but they do have two offerings of sushi on the menu. The place is small with seating inside and outside also. Since it is still warn in Phoenix this time of year I decided to eat inside. This place is maybe the cleanest place I have visited. It was so clean it almost hurt the eyes. No dust or dirt anywhere. Service was as good as it gets. I ordered a teriyaki rice bowel and since I wanted some sushi the spicy tuna roll and ice tea.  The cashier called over a employee and gave them my cup to be filled with ice tea. I could of gotten the tea but this is part of their service. My teriyaki bowel was delivered first. The food was good and really more there than one person needs to eat. My sushi came. It was also good. Then came more customer service. The lady that had filled my cup with tea was back asked if I needed more tea. I said yes and away she went with my cup. She refilled it with ice and then the tea. The owner then came up and asked if everything was ok. Nice touch.  A lot of the people coming in and out must eat there often as they were greeted with hello (their name).  So how was the food? The food was good and plentiful and inexpensive.  Would I go back? I have told many people about this place and if I was in the area, yes I would go back. The customer service was the best I have ever seen in a fast food establishment. Many places could learn a lot by going in and experiencing this good customer service.

SWW_ulGnmVJse2ccdWf_QA.text: I love the way the chicken is placed in the plate! it's like chicken chicken chicken, everywhere! haha. But really it does look like that, not to mention it taste pretty bomb diggity licious. Lil hole in the wall tho, they should get a bigger place. you wont be disappointed with the blue fin, Promise

ozYx_KKoNDcP8HjOgojrKw.text: How have I not written a review for Blue Fin?  This isn't going to be the most useful review, because all i can say is that I agree with most of the comments others have written.    Just a word of warning.  Every single time I've been there I've melted the tastebuds off my tongue.  I try to allow my food to cool, but I just can't.  I'm impatient, and maybe a little stoopid.

02fQsdsNhaQN8zfkzvP_nQ.text: Reminds me a lot of the holes in the wall I used to eat at in Hawaii. Went at the height of lunch hour so the line was out the door but my GF and I didn't mind the wait since the weather outside also reminded me of Hawaii. Food was pretty tasty despite the order being slightly botched, sticky steamed rice was perfect and the service was awesome. Don't like that the drinks aren't self serve but it's a minor nit pick.

QxeYqTQ2D3WnGE9UQc8ysA.text: The Blue Fin is a great little place and it truly needs our love. Due to the light rail biz for them has dropped a bit.  I've never been disappointed with anything I have ordered. The gyoza is great, the beef curry and chicken curry bowls are huge, filling and delicious.  I'm always looking for good ice tea and Blue Fin has it.   The owners and staff are always friendly and very accomodating.   This place is small and around lunch time can be packed. They do have a drive thru and if you call ahead all you have to do is pull up to the window and your food is waiting. The drive thru window as far as I know is only for call in orders you can't just pull up and order food.  My only complaint is they are not open on weekends.

FfoPF05QVWUfF11FRbd3Vg.text: Not a sushi bar! They do have some rolls, though.   Great menu with all of the Japanese fast food favorites. They make everything on-site and it's cheap. Ideal downtown spot for lunch or early dinner.

JnS27HAIkv4sJduCFthyzQ.text: What? Only one review for Blue Fin on Yelp (as of October 2007)? That's crazy! This place is a True gem. Oh wait, maybe that's why there's only one review...  Well, not to overcrowd this little spot which is usually busy enough, but I have to sing their praises a little bit. Blue Fin serves very good, healthful Japanese food and is run by some of the sweetest people you'll ever meet (thanks Howard and Betsy!)  I've tried many things on the menu and it's all very tasty. However there's one dish that I always go back for and find myself craving - the white meat teriyaki chicken. Yes, I know, teriyaki is the most common Japanese dish in America, but Blue Fin's is simply awesome.   Most restaurants serve teriyaki as chicken with commercially-made sauce squeezed on top. But Blue Fin marinates their chicken in a homemade teriyaki that's just incredible. It's a big serving and I rarely leave any on the plate. Order it with the salad and it's even better - the best asian salad dressing beside's flo's asian kitchen. And sprinkle on some of the spicy seasoning that's on the table, too. hard to beat it.  Only drawback lately is all the construction around the area, but hey that's downtown these days. And we're lucky Blue Fin is still there - the city had planned to buy and demolish the building, but customers put up such a fuss they decided to let them stay. Hurray for democracy! And hurray for Blue Fin!

R_6usTdXAHsMYXOfCIHxOA.text: When traveling in downtown Phoenix, there is always a lot to choose from during the day for food stops. One of the places that has been here for as long as I can remember, yes seriously that long! Is The Blue Fin. I remeber thinking 30 years ago ,I wonder how long this place will be here.  Yet here it stands in 2013 still going strong. Which makes me really happy.  I love when local business can do great!  They have always been great ,very friendly service and fresh food. The panko breaded items are light and feel healthy. All the vegetables I get here are  always crisp and fresh. I guess it is because, they take pride in the place. Something you do not always see. I believe that they have lunch specials every week day. However , they do charge extra for the little things. Like making it extra spicy is like .35 extra and brown rice is a little extra, I mean barley enough to where you would even notice.  They have soup, and sushi, salad,etc. Lots of nice cool drinks. If the weather is cooler(below 90) you can sit outside and enjoy the light rail going by. Which also means that you can take the light rail here as well. It is located in the same spot as always, right next to the Phoenix, Public Library. When in downtown Phoenix, give it a try.

umub-QD-QdfeyZuARWHODQ.text: The place was real nice. I got the teriyaki beef bowl. It was pretty salty but not bad. I hear the teriyaki chicken is better and plan to get that in the near future! Check this place out!

mA4YFeSTgSrkK2Tt9z4CpA.text: While I was in the area I searched for Sushi and Blue Fin came up. However, I didn't see a sushi menu or bar.  When I first walked in, I was a little disappointed, but after starring at the menu for a couple of seconds, I actually got excited. When I was in NY a couple of months ago, I went to this great Japanese curry place that was a hole in the wall and had the best Japanese curry I have ever tried.  I searched for something similar when I got back to Phoenix without success. So when I was standing there I saw Japanese curry on the menu and got super excited.  I ordered a bowl of that- the chicken wasn't the chicken katsu, but regular cooked chicken with carrots. It was pretty good but not what my taste buds searching for. I hate when I eat something great on vacation and cannot find it anywhere back home...  Nevertheless, I hope to be back to try  the teriyaki and other things on their menu.

-EH8GPeURl5idmnselw8nA.text: Holy moly! I'm addicted. This place is amazing! Friendl6, fast service. I had the panko chicken it was amazing, filling and a great price. I will be at this place a lot!

YIh38PV3ShCpgulzQG3P6Q.text: I do find it ironic for a place named the blue fin to not have blue fin on the menu.  I went here today with my co worker for lunch. We found a spot in back with no issue, just make sure you head north on central to get here as the light rail makes entry from south bound impossible.  I ordered the vegetable yaki soba with tofu, and then took a seat at the front patio. Our food was borough to us only a few minutes later.   I tried a bit or two with out the addition of condiments, it was a bit bland and the tofu was much softer than I like. After adding copious amounts of black sesame seeds and red pepper the dish took on new life. The texture contrast of the seeds with the tofu worked and the spices stuck well to the noodles. The vegetables them self were plain, sliced carrots, cabbage, broccoli and celery.   My co worker had the panco chicken, which was just sliced fried chicken on rice, they were nice and gave him every sauce to try.   The food was decent, not the best, not the worst, the value was acceptable as well and the staff was friendly. I will be back, no huge rush however.

_AZ1wQABE_EJmq_t0La47A.text: First time I came to eat here in 20 years. Congrats on staying in business!  The owner is so sweet. She absolutely keeps this place successful I'm sure. Oyako chicken bowl : it's good. But they use the same chopped up chicken they use for teriyaki I think. So if you expect a True Japanese Oyako, this isn't quite it. With that said - I'm being picky because I'm Japanese. Eggs should be somewhat runny and mine was completely scrambled dry like you get in Mexican burritos.   5 stars for service and 4 stars for food quality :-)

VFC8SvLI2DZy8VbLI0NwJg.text: Cheap..great taste...Quick service and good quantity..nothing here deserves less than 5 stars. It s a small mom pop kinda shop serving great Japanese food. I tried the teriyaki chicken combo. For 6 bucks it was good deal. A definite visit if you are in the area.

xmuw8w38eyX5mDmKlaBXtQ.text: Really like the panko fish here. I've been coming here since the 6th grade, since I went to school right around the corner. I have ALWAYS loved it. They even made it through the lightrail constructions fiasco that ate up a lot of nearby businesses -- Blue Fin never fails. I hope I see this restaraunt around when I send my kids to school downtown, because they are consistent, they are incredibly friendly, and clean. It's nice to still feel like you're getting a home cooked meal from a neighbor, and you get that here.  Also -- they have red bean paste Mochi, for any interested. Just ask. It's tasty!

bSCpwSBRNgIw_qQAJKi7RQ.text: It is easily the best place in Phoenix for teriyaki. They do a great job at all their other food too, but, mmm the teriyaki!! Go there, try something.

7i8HjS-WEBnQva7D1jkRRA.text: I'm so glad we have this Asian fast food place on Central Avenue, and near a light rail stop at that. Satisfying, generous fare (love their  sicky rice and the panko dishes!) served by friendly folk; a good number of dishes to choose from; good prices, very informal atmosphere, even a patio for alfresco dining. I feel happy supporting  a local independent business establishment, and even happier that this establishment serves tasty, very filling meals that are not a strain on the budget.

nVLb7k_h13ga7d9RU8bptg.text: Inexpensive, good, and great service make this place a must. We decided to try Blue Fin for lunch, and found the place pretty packed. It's small to begin with so its doesn't take much. I ordered sweet and sour chicken, my girlfriend had Panko chicken.  Prices can't really be lower without being on the dollar menu.  The chicken was decent, not really the best I've had but certainly not the worst. For the price I'm not complaining. 3 maybe 4 stars... but then the service. As we sat outside one of the owners came out to greet us, chatted a bit and took our large cup to refill it for us. Her smile was pleasant enough but her warm inviting attitude and complete joy to hear we tried her restaurant for the first time was wonderful.  I'm big on service, so when she thanked us over and over for coming by for lunch and encouraged us to come back, well that just sealed it for me.

SKdUXODe_zPMda0M0zhWGw.text: After visiting the Phoenix Public Library, I had a sudden craving for some  japanese food. This restaurant happened to be right across from it, so I decided  to eat there.  I ordered the Panko Fish Bowl,  but to my dismay; I was informed that they were out of fish, so the owner suggested the coconut shrimp.  I was pretty happy with it and I thought the special orange sauce was flavorful.  The prices are also pretty affordable and the food comes out pretty quick.  But the real reason why I  am giving this business 4 stars is  based on the fact that the owner and the staff of this establishment are helpful and honest. (I lost my cellphone there last week and they found it.)  Plus I prefer to spend my money on local independent business like this one rather than a national chain.

goVd85H0N5FOivPW75-ncA.text: I have always wanted to try this place. Unfortunately, I decided to do that today. I ordered the pork katsu and my friend ordered the yakisoba. It was very underwhelming to say the least. The Katsu was steamed with an egg and not traditionally prepared and the yakisoba look like noodles with chicken on top with a little bit of sauce. Not what I was expecting. I did contact the manager, And explain my expectations versus what was delivered. She mentioned that her chef was from Japan and this is how he prepared it. I have never seen it this way ever! She did trade out both items for teriyaki dishes, but both of those were again, not so good. While I applaud the manager for trying to rectify the situation, I will not be back.

q9e6geNrgXzdBbOwYFL4lA.text: AVOID the teriyaki chicken!  It's really, really bad.  Driest I've ever had, and I never understood my colleagues loving it so much.  Whenever I would come here for lunch I would stick to the panko fish or pork katsu, plus a mochi for dessert.  The inari sushi is also good.  Their rice is fine, but the nickel and dining up-charge for brown rice or spicier food just makes them look cheap.  Note that it does get crowded during the lunch rush, and the better (non-teriyaki chicken) items take longer to cook.

b6qZahL6ZJ8A9vvHjoO_6w.text: Been here several times.  Each time I ordered a different dish and each time without fail, the food as been delicious. What makes this place even better are the owners. The sweetest people I have ever met...they truly care about their customers and their product.  So try it out and they will make you feel at home.

zGrffx4boiBNJtKSRV-xlQ.text: I started working for the State Dept of Transportation in about 1983.  I discovered this place shortly after.  The food is consistently good and not very expensive.  I usually got the chicken teriyaki, but have started branching out into the Panko Fish and some kind of pork/egg bowl.  Both were very good.  You can get a bowl of your meat with rice, or upgrade to a plate that comes with rice and salad.  I like to chat with the daughter, who graduated from MIT and has a wit that is refreshing to experience.  They also have fresh sushi rolls that I've had upon occasion.

t0e3GGPN1dIFVd9wblwtcA.text: Good. Definitely will come back. $10 for curry chicken bowl + cucumber salad + 3 piece shrimp tempera

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Fin - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Blue Fin - Phoenix, AZ, United States

SUHJotK2WwmQ79YB7EXbzA.text: Came in after looking up japanese food on yelp. My wife and i came in while we were on a trip to phoenix. What we found was one of the nicest people we have ever met and a great restaurant! My wife ordered the chicken katsu which is called panko chicken here which she enjoyed and got nice portions. I got the chicken curry which after the owner let me know that for $2 more she would double the size. Which i promptly did and got a nice helping of food. It's very comfy home style cooking. I can't say enough good things about thw owner she was very friendly and engaged in conversation with everyone. The prices are incredibly reasonable! Highly recommend it!

aqu5i82BIftdd5RsVesjHg.text: This place is a Phoenix institution and has been in operation for 33 years! The dishes are inexpensive, great sized portions and full of flavour.  For around $5 you can get a big bowl of rice and teriyaki chicken, for a dollar more, beef or fish. The panko chicken is excellent and comes with a choice of three sauces. My girlfriend's favourite is the vegetable bowl, which comes in under $5! She loves it. Appetizers are also inexpensive - 4 gyoza with pork or shrimp for under $1.79 and 3 spring rolls for $1.39. The sushi is a bit boring, although again, very inexpensive.  The service is amazing - personable, engaging and friendly. Decor is a bit dated, but that doesn't bother me. I'd rather the prices stay low than pay a premium for fancy booths and a mural of Mount Fuji.  I only wish they stayed open a little later than 6:30....

vSsiDhSyE6KIpy73zlvg1Q.text: This is definitely my go to lunch place. I found it on Yelp one day and never looked back.   I am a creature of habit so I get the same thing every week: A spicy all white meat teriyaki chicken bowl ($6). The portion is SO big. I have never been to any restaurant that actually over serves the meat portion. I typically find myself wanting a little more rice to finish all the chicken with. I love the way the chicken is cooked and the spicy teriyaki is just the right amount of spice.   I will also sometimes splurge and get some dumplings ($2 with tax) which always come out very hot and taste great with their soy based sauce. It's not a traditional dumpling sauce that I love but it's still pretty good with the dumplings.  The service at this restaurant though is what pushes me to give them a top notch rating. The people here are just such genuinely nice people. They are very helpful and they get your food out quick. I really do not have one con for this place. The prices are amazing for what they offer, the staff reminds me of my own family and they treat you like you are their family and the food is always fresh tasting and yummy.

OcAxYrP0_r5ibFOnXNCaZw.text: First time here, and I devoured the teriyaki chicken plate w/spring rolls! SO MUCH FOOD -- and I only ordered the lunch special! It could have easily fed two people, but if it is that good, why share? I love places like this. Simple restaurant specializing in something they do best, and this is the place to come for teriyaki. My food arrived at my patio table in less than 10 minutes. The salad had a delicious citrusy/sesame tasting dressing that mixed well with the rice and chicken. Chicken was so tender, and the teriyaki was neither too sweet or salty! Perfect taste. Since I like super spicy food, my only regret was not squirting Sriracha sauce all over it. However, I didn't realize that until AFTER I was half way done with my meal. It was so flavorful my spicy craving didn't even kick in I was way too full to continue on.   Good for lunch or early dinner since this place closes early. Drive-up window if you are in a rush!

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Fin - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken teriyaki plate with spring rolls
Photo of Blue Fin - Phoenix, AZ, United States

2HWv6U0nnu2eVdJyJpdwXg.text: This is one of the restaurants that is close to my hotel. I came here for a quick snack. I ordered the Teriyaki Chicken Katsu lunch Bowl. For $5.50+ tax, I get two pieces of Chicken Katsu drenched in Teriyaki Sauce. Unfortunately, I find the chicken pieces not too fresh and unbearable to eat. Though a nice size snack for me, but I find the bowl very unsatisfying. My rice bowl: yelp.com/biz_photos/oMBN... With locals enjoying this restaurant and the high-rating, the restaurant has the Yelp Sticker posted on the diner's door. I'm not too sure if this place deserves the famous red-sticker! Maybe I'm spoiled, because I live in San Francisco/Bay Area and get better rice bowls from places like Kaz Teriyaki and Suruki Supermarket (both located in Downtown San Mateo). This is probably one of the better places Phoenix has to offer.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Fin - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken Katsu Rice bowl for $5.50

d-4iPVSFmCQdQwGH26IrTg.text: I was super excited to try this place ... They do have Cheap eats for lunch and free refills on their large drinks. And there was not a long wait for the food. We ordered Katsu pork plate and chicken teriyaki. Both lacked flavor and the Katsu looked like puke on a plate and had no rice or breaking on the pork. The teriyaki chicken was very rubbery and had little to no sauce. I'm super disappointed that this place was a bust because it has so many good reviews.

AjZKBLg3nEC36qQHqj7wgQ.text: Good eats. Staff is super friendly and you never have to wait long for your food. I recommend the panko chicken bowl. Never disappoints! I always try to stop in whenever I'm downtown and hungry!

FxWRjK_3NIdoeweF53Y5nA.text: First time, found using Yelp, I had the beef teriyaki plate with salad. Also a side of sunomono. The beef had very good flavor. The sunomono was a little sweet but went well with the teriyaki.

iP-Br3lLU1lI4FeCkhRAjA.text: So with all the reviews on here and passing this place so often it was about time that I maide a stop here. Service was super quick I will say that. And the people were really nice. I got the daily special of teriyaki chicken, two spring rolls and a drink for about $7.50.  The chicken was good, though all the sauce sank down into the rice. SO yeah... overall I am pretty happy with it. Coudln't finish the food, but it was good.

Vj75bbX8zKKIclyI_RlQag.text: The food is always very good.  Not incredible but always very good.  I've been there 6 times now and have never had anything subpar.  I have never seen a spec of dirt.  I have never gotten a wrong order.    The thing that makes The Blue Fin incredible is the service.  I have never seen a group of people who take more pride in serving their customers.  They are some of the kindest people you could possible meet.  How many times do you hear an owner ask if you want more food on your plate while you are staring at a huge mound of meat and rice?  Not said to try and get you to buy more food but because tell she was worried there wasn't enough chicken there.    The portions are hefty for the price, the food is always good, It comes out from the kitchen fast, and the service is incredible.  Definitely make a stop the next time you are in the area.

yN_B5Hs_Mabq9z5nXasjJA.text: The food was okay but not great. Don't plan to find anything healthy on the menu though. It has the feel of a southern California beach joint.

aUF0iucoJyU0tFNaJU3xRA.text: Great food! Fast service! Awesome workers! Business is run the way all should be, attentive to customers & tasty food!

MS_YR4COTs-eY4HCmKw04g.text: I love the fact that I can just get up and head here whenever I am in the mood for Matcha green tea ice cream which is more than you think.The ladies there are very friendly and the food is good and servings are big.

W-x8d6f7BuJ2BI6gB5-Ysw.text: Pros: clean, quick, delicious, friendly, good prices.  Cons: Closed on Saturdays and Sundays.   I love the fried gyoza and a california roll. Can't beat that for lunch, not even with a stick! Okay, maybe with a stick, but you probably wouldn't want to eat it afterwards.

5gaURYMCuPR7es5p3IRUEQ.text: Some of the best teriyaki chicken in phoenix.. Fast and always friendly! If only they were open weekends!!

Gyws8bFdq5ILqyi_3CLsfQ.text: Yummy Japanese hole in the wall type place. Fast, friendly service, great portions of yummy food and they will customize dishes not on the menu.

EL7Mr_RzPbS14dl5wxJ9kg.text: Wow! I can't believe this place gets so many good reviews.  I was hauled here once by co-workers looking for a cheap meal. But, how much value does your lunch dollar have when you don't even want to eat the food? Dry and sticky rice; "white meat chicken" unidientifiable as such, and a sweet glaze that provided the only flavor. Quite frankly, it was disgusting, and none of the dishes my co-workers had looked any better (though they seemed to be fine with them). I should know to stay away from restaurants that have pictures of their menu items on the wall. The one star is only for the fast and friendly service.

hJgK24sV9hKE-QQVj1aCmw.text: The best. I've had at least half the menu and everything is consistently excellent. Crab puffs are super filling and on point, gyoza is perfect, spring rolls rule. The panko fish is my go to; perfectly crisp, fresh and delicious every time. The chicken, whether in teriyaki or panko form, has a wonderful grilled flavor. Not to mention how affordable the prices are for what you're getting, this place is amazing. Service is always efficient and extremely friendly.

seo5E3gea-r4ovFvo0XnTg.text: BUT....DO NOT ORDER ONLINE.  Sweet, sweet people who own this, but they don't have the online order thing down.  I've tried three times and even though I wait 30 min. to pick it up, they haven't had my order once. Not just that it's not ready.. that they have no record of it.   Good food... not your regular teriyaki thick sauce stuff.  If you want a 'to go' order, you'll have to call it in if you want to know for sure it will be ready to pick up. Crab puffs are amazing!!

2imPoRdEzyQ3w_3-nqOmiQ.text: This place is amazing! The food is great but when grandma blue fin comes by to refill you're drink or even your entree, you'll understand  why we all love it!

sfZv1FPnGj8tHalumQuvYA.text: I haven't been to this place in years and was finally working in the area. Got the same thing I always got every time I have gone. I have to say this wasn't as great as I remember. My chicken was pretty dry. And my side salad didn't come with any dressing on it. I also remember the dressing being a more orange-ish Ginger tasting. This was a more white-ish onion tasting. Not a huge fan.  The service was as great as I remember and the people were just as nice as I remember too.

nNCnd1H398M0Y7OqUGDhjA.text: I like it here...quick  food, good prices, yummy.  Be prepared for the line at lunch!  It moves fast though...just know what you want to order when you get there...otherwise, you might get trampled by the stampede!  Patio is fantastic!

t4Of6VrBI8bbeZir7Tk9nw.text: Even if I didn't like the food I would still come here. The people are so friendly. My favorite is the Panko chicken bowl with tankatsu.

6a_KsuLBwN3WppuYYcfI6w.text: Been living in Willow for almost 20 years. An old girl friend told me how lucky I'd be to live so close to Blue Fin. Personally I prefer the Tonkatsu, fish or chicken, with brown rice. I prefer to take it home or eat at the park next to the library.

PNhw6Lo_QTiLpN3kSn5onA.text: Quick, easy, cheap, and large portions.   I have been here 3 times for lunch and there is never a long wait and they are always quick to bring me my order. I had a teriyaki chicken bowl that came with a large amount of rice. It was just over 5 dollars. So 5 dollars for a very big lunch and it was pretty tasty works for me.   I did also have the sweet and sour chicken that I didn't care for because it was breaded and it made it seem like there was no chicken under the breading.

F79GyGFLNt78yRwkm33uMw.text: Terrific spot in downtown Phoenix!  I love the Panko Chicken, Teriyaki Chicken and the Curry Vegetables first and foremost.  Beyond that, it's all good and healthy portions.  Tankatsu sauce is a favorite right now too.

5tOZqGtnL2Atzl3ZxHC1qg.text: The best teriyaki you can get for lunch! I love this place and the staff is always pleasant. The healthy special is a great pick that comes with brown rice, white meat teriyaki chicken, salad, and your choice of tea or lemonade. Perfect.

7WpdoJdL8UHNUMNV2fAcAA.text: I've  heard about this place for years. Everyone raves about it so I finally had to go in and pick up dinner just to check it out. I wish I'd stopped in much sooner. Great food. Fast service. I will definitely be back.

4N5Lu5hVKL8K-OfLGu7z6A.text: I followed the trail left by fellow Yelpers and this was as accurate it goes.   Ambience: There is not much to it. Even the owner admits that much. However, it is bright and open. Most of all, it looks welcoming.    Food: It's very good, but most of all, it's excellent bang for the buck! The teriyaki is not too sweet and it is well seasoned. I ordered the chicken fried rice with Iced tea. It was great. The iced tea comes with unlimited refills which the owner often reminds the customers while I was there.  Service: Although it is a "self-service" restaurant, the owner and staff was extremely helpful to a fault. She refilled my iced tea a couple of times.  I will return for sure. The owner did take her time to talk to most if not all her customers. If you are looking for a friendly place with good food, this would be it! It definitely does not hurt that the food is very affordable.

cSOxUL47KMGBiDgq4y3yXA.text: Yelp let me down.   Went here based on reviews and it was down the street and this place was gross. We had the katsu pork and panko chicken and yuck. We didn't finish either one and should have given the leftovers to one of the many homeless people hanging around this place.   Not knocking anyone, maybe it's just my taste buds but idk what people are talking about. I will never go back here.

0uyeQHFI0HNnp0FPgQs5LQ.text: On Saturday, my wife and I went to the Japanese Matsuri at Heritage Park in Phoenix.  For lunch we stopped by the kiosk of Phoenix Blue Fin.  We purchased two bento boxes:  Panko Chicken Shrimp Tempura  Both were okay.  My wife and I found the food to be edible, but it is not special.  This place is perhaps okay for the lunch crowd or related, but I do not think that it would be something worth trekking all the way to Central Phoenix for from where I live (Mesa AZ).  I can find comparable out in the East Valley.

O6LcZ6NhGsJFEGM1VtxGpw.text: The chicken katsu is boss here. Islanders if you're missing home stop by.  Do not get the inari. They were kind and asked me if I wanted something else(thumbs up).  I come from Pearl City and Kabuki's giant cone can not be beat unless you are at New Years and somebody's obachan made it herself.  Alrighty off to explore chopsticks in hand.  P. S. Along with the good old greenbacks they accept MasterCard visa and American Express no apple pay. :(

A7HsObwc-S1e_0kcMM-f1g.text: In Downtown Phoenix this is my go to restaurant for great Chicken Teriyaki or for a casual, quick and healthy Asian lunch (or early dinner).   The owners and staff are always cheerful, smiling and friendly.  If you need help choosing something to eat their always honest and willing to help you pick out something delicious.  The restaurant has very quick service and is usually bustling with happy satisfied regulars, and there is a drive up window too.

nPhIftgkB_GErmI5JxiIkA.text: Love love love this Phoenix staple. Service with a smile and the best panko I've had. The orange sauce is amazing and I love their oniony salad dressing.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Fin - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Panko chicken plate

-qo8aQNgeVyiThQGnW9M5Q.text: Blue fin is just as good as it was when I ate here for lunch over 25 years ago. Surprisingly the prices havent changed much either.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Fin - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Blue Fin - Phoenix, AZ, United States

nvRceSetsGgCQzb897WXNw.text: Japanese cuisine is one of my favorites, so I was quite geeked that this place was on my side of town. It came recommended by a few co-workers, as they frequent the joint often. However for me, I will be "waving bye" as I frequently drive past Blue Fin.  The menu has some of my favorite common Japanese dishes (Teriyaki Chicken, Tonkatsu, etc.). I decided to roll with the White Chicken Katsu (Panko Breaded Chicken) and some Shrimp Tempura - relatively common, easy to make, usually tasty Japanese dishes. Well, I did not know they would use Arizona sand as the breading. The chicken was so over cooked and bland that it dried my mouth. Luckily there was enough grease to squeeze into my mouth from the Shrimp Tempura to combat the dryness.   The saving grace for Blue Fin are the portions and price point. One can chow down for a small price, but you will be sacrificing quality. Be sure to ask for extra water if ordering anything breaded!

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Fin - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp Tempura and White Chicken Katsu.

D38SXsJ9qPy96gY7h7IvEg.text: Stopped here for a late lunch on a sweltering Monday afternoon. It's a small shop with maximized seating, just across the street from the library and streetcar downtown. I was thrilled to not have to pay for parking, as they have a small area on the south end for parallel parking. Everything was incredibly clean and cared-for.   When I saw Japanese curry on the menu, I almost cried from happiness. With a small fountain drink, my total was under $8. Although it's not the best Japanese curry I've ever had, it was still delicious. I found the curry flavor itself to be a little...watered down. Japanese curry is more mild and savory than other curry styles, so a slightly higher concentration of the curry in the sauce would have knocked my lunch out of the park.  I didn't know this until after the fact, but you can request heat levels here, and they also have shakers on the table to customize the degree of spiciness.

DipcEqMvfKhDTmz97EeZTA.text: I really enjoyed this place.  I've seen it a hundred times when going to the library and I finally was in the area right about lunch time.  I got the coconut shrimp plate which has the shrimp, salad, and white rice.  Add a massively large drink (with free refills) and the total was just over $10.  More than filling.  If you don't want the drink and get a smaller rice bowl instead of a plate then you can probably grab a fresh lunch for under $7.  Everything just kind of works together.  I saw the salad on top of warm rice and my mind wasn't too excited, but there is something about the way they make it where it just mixes together well.  The dressing really makes it all come together.  The shrimp is hot, fresh, and isn't overly greasy; no oil splotches on the plate.  The dipping sauce is, like the dressing, a really good compliment to the shrimp.  Everything on the plate was good and a nice change of pace.  Really friendly workers, nice mix of guests, very convenient parking.  It looks small but it can handle a lot of people and there is even a drive-thru window.  One minor negative, and this is kind of strange, but it's the fork size.  It's a small plastic fork and you can't really get rice and lettuce on it.  I asked for a spoon after a few minutes of trying to balance everything.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Fin - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Coconut shrimp plate, massive drink, $10.50.

CsRM18LcPF2EakAnx_nkzQ.text: Great lunch plate, chicken teriyaki for about  $7. Comes with teriyaki,  rice, fresh salad, and 2 egg rolls. It is located in a convenient downtown corner off rail station.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Fin - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delisch! Chicken teriyaki lunch plate, salad was fresh, the egg rolls are an amazing addition to the teriyaki chicken.

HhlF_YWycHqZ6-ajcdA3fg.text: I have to say I am quite surprised by all the great reviews for this restaurant. And, I also hate leaving negative reviews. That being said, I only tried the chicken teriyaki bowl. The chicken was shaved and was so dry it was hard to swallow. The teriyaki sauce was so watered down it turned my rice into soup. I was very disappointed with the quality of the chicken teriyaki bowl. I don't think they understand that it is possible to completely dry out chicken when over cooked.   I don't think I will be back to try anything else based on this experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Fin - Phoenix, AZ, United States

RlmKw7IXCd8ZKJX-7wDvaw.text: Delicious. That sums it up. Looks like a small, somewhat sketchy little place, but don't be fooled. The Panko chicken meal is awesome, comes with rice and a salad with your hour of sauce for the chicken.  Best part is its under $8 for a huge plate of food. One of my downtown favorites when I am starving!

Im54bsgkbwasnBYEFxSQHg.text: This Japanese spot has good weekday lunch specials.  I got the Teriyaki Chicken.  It was nothing special-chicken was plentiful but lacking in flavor-seemed to have been quickly immersed in a very light sauce-but no grilled flavor.  Plenty of rice and salad-very filling but not as satisfying as I expected.

_W0p-Bj4o3ByfxkLvukSLQ.text: First time here. Very friendly. Food was very good. Right across from the light rail.  On Central Ave. I don't like the smell every morning whey they are cleaning the fryers. The old grease smell is all over the neighborhood.

jWZbf8OSZGqmKR7OfJtn9Q.text: Great stop for lunch or dinner. The front cashier is always so friendly and in a great mood which always is nice to have. Teriyaki chicken is my favorite with the hot sauce paste on the side. Very quick service, I take mine to go to eat at work. Always have a great experience here and price is very reasonable. Wish they stayed open later till maybe 10. Overall food and atmosphere is very nice, my favorite Japanese spot in Central Phoenix.

da0_gimNp7oIWNTXxNROqQ.text: The best fast food in downtown Phoenix!  This hidden gem is the perfect stop when you only have a short time for lunch.  Their bowls are packed with fresh veggies and the teri chicken is so tender.  The prices are reasonable and the staff is super friendly.

OnGPtItLxfGm3gGpvHNm3A.text: Every time I come downtown, I try to work this place in to my time here. Easily accessible from the light rail, and delicious food! Service is always fast, and price is very low. If I lived downtown I would be here every day!   Personally, my favorite is their coconut shrimp. I dont normally eat shrimp. Actually, I rarely eat any meat, but even if I went fully vegetarian I'd have to make an exception for that one dish.

E0s_H6ZbZ0uWEEA8qNRTPw.text: Cute little place with great teriyaki!! Business owner is a very nice older lady, she cheerfully walks around the tables to check if everything is well.    The Service is outstanding, teriyaki was delicious with rice and veggies. Also if you get a large drink, you get unlimited refills! Yay for raspberry tea!!  Great small business with good food and great service.  Its a must visit if  you're around the area!! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Fin - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Teriyaki Chicken with Veggies!!
Photo of Blue Fin - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mango Sorbet!! :) Awesomeness!

CKZar9nbKKfwtcfkGSE24Q.text: ok, what is wrong with me? I want to love this place like everyone else does but when it comes to the food I can't quite get behind it. I want to love their slightly smokey tasting chicken teriyaki but I can't help but feel that it is more than a little dry. I want to get behind their oyako bowl but I am just not super fond of the onion crowded omelette.   If I were rating it just on service and sweetness of staff it would get 5 stars in my book though!

YmRxYe9qkpdWaTQthF3EZg.text: First time, had the curry chicken plate, very delicious!  Prices are way reasonable, clean inside, super friendly staff!  I'll be back for sure.

YAuRTi0p3DUBwOBsmrFprA.text: Delicious terriyaki chicken ... and always delivered with a huge smile.    Blue Fin is a family operated business.  The people who work there are the absolute nicest people in the world!  You can tell they really enjoy cooking for their customers and they make you feel like family when you eat there - even if it's you're 1st time there.    You need to try this place if you haven't.  GREAT FOOD, GREAT PEOPLE, AND GREAT PRICES.

b-xxBBkibGr3Gm-tGIfcYw.text: My boss took me here for my birthday last month and I was SURPRISED! I thought hmmm, little crowded, little small, little dirty.... not impressed, AND THEN... I tried the avocado crab salad and I saw the clouds parting above and angels coming to sing hallelujah. This place has AMAZING food. My friend and boss had the same thing but tells me the Teriyaki bowls are good too and I will be back to try them.   The atmosphere was very homey as I discovered once I got over my claustrophobia. All the other customers seemed to be VERY friendly and even had us talking across tables and joining in conversations we normally wouldn't have done. Being from a very "suburban" neighborhood with no flavor I think this place has inspired me to try all the little places near work and believe me now my adventure has begun. Thank you Blue Fin!

27II5qPsYA8bqaVWM1e2JQ.text: The only thing better than Blue Fin's food is their service!  Everyone was so polite and friendly!  You couldn't help but leave with a smile on your face!  I also loved that they offer Hawaiian juices in addition to their other beverages.  This place was excellent and I can't wait to go back!

ALVeet2a67ywWdXWFdwNgw.text: Went to Blue Fin for lunch today. The service was quick and very kind. My vegetarian egg roll was perfectly crispy and flavorful, and for the first time in my life I didn't have to spit the first bite back out because it was too hot for consumption. Not sure what happened with my Vegetable Yakisoba, but it had NO flavor. Really, none. When I got it home I had to smother it with Soy Vay, which is kind of sad. I'll definitely go back (the price is right), but with a different game plan in mind for my order.

znc1dTxl0WEnw3g8boeNZg.text: A Phoenix classic and well worth a visit.  I used to eat there frequently, many years ago, but sort of forgot about the place.  Went yesterday and it was so tasty, cheap, and healthy (veg cooked with no oil).  Super friendly and helpful staff, too.  I'll be back more often!

Uv4qqhA0zaIJjXTKmEG4sQ.text: We traveled from California to stay in Goodyear for a few weeks and we looking for a good and simple lunch. After reading all the reviews on yelp we just had to try it. This casual  cafe is run by a Chinese family from Southern California. When we arrived for lunch, the place was packed with a lot of business workers looking for a cheap and quick lunch. Many people also ordered take out. The workers were fast and efficient. This place mainly serves teriyaki rice bowls and rice plates. The rice bowls were so delicious that we had to come back again later to order take out for our dinner. We highly recommend this place for you to try.

LOYfcjy517nWLfIV77b1xA.text: Hadn't been before but my fiance has been going for ages.  I had the coconut shrimp, very good and moderately priced.  Very friendly service.  It'll definitely be a place I consider in the future, especially if I'm using the light rail in the central Phoenix area.

h7h9JUCpIpA52ac0XuCOiQ.text: This place offers pretty good food at really low prices. i think it's a mother daughter team that own it and they are the sweetest ladies ever. It's probably not a good idea to order a hot yakisoba bowl  on a hot day and eat it on the patio. I try to always eat with chopsticks and i just kept getting hot  sauce on my face.  Oh only complaint is their tofu. It's just diced and sauteed. i would like it if maybe they marinated, baked and then sauteed. Panko fish is delicious!

Au8gX2TXRuGLiLqxJBCOzQ.text: My family and I have eaten here at least a hundred times over the years. This is one of two spots we eat lunch at if we are near downtown Phoenix. The price is right and the service is always excellent as is the food. The family who runs the restaurant is always very friendly. I would recommend this place to anyone. My only complaint is that they only have one location in the valley.

Xvh4zYg0TG-Q5u5ZrDuY0Q.text: My boss says his body is a temple and won't eat anywhere else but Blue Fin.  So he took me there for my birthday.  So good...their salad has an amazing dressing (not sure what the taste is).  The ladies knew my boss and were very personable.  I go back often.  I get the teriyaki chicken with brown rice.  Reasonably priced and the ladies are so sweet.

XFg3P8PjrMK13_2FueVvPg.text: I had very high expectations for this place after all the Yelp praise, expectations Blue Fin mostly lived up to. The place itself is nothing special, although they do have a big patio for when the weather is cooler. However, the food is very good and super cheap. Their daily special is quite the bargain - $6.75 gets you chicken teriyaki (all white meat, if you prefer, at no extra cost) over white rice with a side salad and two mini spring rolls. The spring rolls were very good, although a little greasy. The salad was good, although a little warm. The chicken teriyaki was great, but not your traditional teriyaki. Unlike most places, it seems like they cook the chicken in the sauce so that it's coated with the teriyaki flavor, rather tossing the chicken with the sauce or pouring sauce on top before serving it. That makes it a little more dry than I'm used to, but it also gives it a nice smokiness. Their sauce is a little less sweet than my Americanized Japanese palate is used to (Yoshi's, for instance, has a much sweeter sauce), but it's definitely more authentic. The best part of this place is the service - the people here are incredibly friendly, welcoming, and helpful.

hehoKmYUETIU1yHkVDHrBQ.text: closes at 6:30pm... but is a good meal. would like to try more meals. teriyaki chicken bowl is nice and hot. looks locally owned.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Fin - Phoenix, AZ, United States. teriyaki chicken bowl

AuyGskMDwzCHMjdq1XqmsA.text: I had take out ... a teriyaki chicken bowl with veggies instead of rice and a California roll. The teriyaki bowl was ok for the price , loved the veggies but the meat was a little tough to me. The sushi was gross , I don't recommend it.

6JalyeZ2wSR98F_EByrMEw.text: Blue fin is such a hidden treasure. This little joint serve delicious meals perfect for lunchtime or on the go. I often order to go for my lunch break

Say1ysO4yOukQIYauWQjKQ.text: Pros: Fair prices, lots of fresh veggies, very friendly service.   Cons: Overuse of styrofoam, bland yakisoba noodles (no sauce?!).

0fo3o6DrMAgzE0VyZPR5oA.text: This place is not what I was expecting.  From the outside it looks like a little regular old teriyaki place.  When you walk inside the decor is lovely and everything is super clean.  Even the bathrooms were spotless.  I ordered the teriyaki chicken plate along with a cucumber salad and it exceeded my expectations.  Every employee was very friendly and treats you like family.  Such a lovely place to have lunch.  I will most definitely be back.

PwNQ7LfGAKImArVk1rp8bA.text: The Blue Fin is an amazing place to come get a delicious and affordable lunch. You can tell if you sit here long enough that regulars are here often and it is a friendly community spot. The owner is extremely nice and always makes her guests feel welcome. They also have a drive thru!

xzAGrQJ2puYdwCpjIdOFpQ.text: I've actually dined in with the Blue Fin crew a number of times in the past.  Though tonight was the first time in awhile.  I remember generally liking the food at Blue Fin, but that it just wasn't memorable.  Admittedly I've dined at Asian fast food spots a bunch in my life so I guess after awhile some of them sort of blend together in my mind and on my palette.  I was actually on my way to the grocery store on this Friday evening.  But with traffic snarled thanks to rain (the thing that turns Phoenix drivers into horror movie co-conspirators), I pulled off and decided to grab a quick meal at Blue Fin.  Blue Fin is easy to spot on Central Avenue (just north of the main public library on Culver Street, two blocks south of McDowell).  A small relatively nondescript building with a small number of outside seats surrounded by nothing but asphalt for a whole block.  It quite literally sticks out.  The inside is equally free of fanciness with seating for maybe 20 and the menus are taped to different points all over the restaurant.  I was actually looking for the entree menu, but I failed to look around the corner to see the entree menu taped to the back of the soda machine.  Coming for the first time?  Keep your eyes open for the menu items taped to the back wall and elsewhere.      So I instead went with an item I could find on the menu in front of me.  I went with the White Chicken Panko plate.  White chicken fried in Japanese bread crumbs, with white rice and a salad and a side of tonkatsu sauce (basically a Japanese version of BBQ sauce).  Total cost for the plate including drink and tax came to about $9.  Came out in about 5 minutes.  The plate portion will definitely fill you up as there was plenty of meat and sides to satisfy pretty much any appetite.  The chicken itself was pretty solid and I liked the slightly sweet notes of the tonkatsu sauce.  The white rice was, well, white rice.  Though for me the big downer of this dish was the salad.  I'm not sure what type of dressing they put on, but they put on a ton (too much I thought).  The onion notes on the dressing were far too overpowering for me and ruined the texture of the lettuce for my taste.  I tried pairing the salad with the rice and chicken to make it more palatable, but no luck.  I've had other dishes here before without salad such as the teriyaki bowl and the sweet and sour chicken bowl and they're perfectly respectable.  Even after tonight though I have to say the food reminds me a great deal of other Japanese fast food standouts of yore such as Yoshi's and Shogun Express.  If you love that sort of food, Blue Fin will be right up your alley.  If I were in a lunch rush and needed some quick takeout, I'd certainly consider Blue Fin for that purpose.  But as a sit down option I'd take a friend or for a dinner stop, Blue Fin wouldn't be among my top choices.    But hey, judge for yourself.  The staff here is friendly, the prices are cheap and the food comes out quick.  Maybe you'll love this place moreso than I have, maybe you won't.  Might want to tell them to hold the salad dressing just to be on the safe side.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Fin - Phoenix, AZ, United States. White Chicken Panko plate w/Tonkatsu sauce.  $8

_G-74wxZpslMVYfZY3xMJQ.text: Wonderful staff. Owners like to walk around making everyone feel welcomed. Affordable and delicious.

RxydX89VXVLBqQDo8KteAQ.text: I love this place. The owners are the nicest people, the food is fantastic. I eat the daily special almost once a week. This is a phoenix favorite!

TJ9THGaKfojQoBunmc1kdw.text: Back in Phx and legit excited to be so close to them again. Great food. Great price. Great service.

WpnjU_ng7CmanCPRzh3AGg.text: MY ORDER - Tempura Shrimp - Pork Egg Roll - California Rolls - Teriyaki Chicken, Rice, and Salad Plate - Bottled Water  THE FOOD Everything was delicious. When I was there, a fireman came in and, while he was waiting for his food, shared with the owner about a fire truck that visits once a year for an annual event, and for lunch, with their choice of anywhere in the valley, they chose to come here, to Blue Fin.  THE SERVICE The best part of my visit here was the service. Even if the food was only mediocre (again, it was delicious), I would go again just for the great service. The place is family owned. The staff was kind and patient. When I was seated, they came to check-in multiple times, offering extra sauces, a cover to keep my plate warm while I enjoyed my appetizers, extra cups of ice and water, and more. Mind you, this isn't a table service restaurant. This isn't a waiter earning a tip. This was grandma caring about the folks who chose to come to eat at her place. While I was here, I also observed a to-go order. They went through the receipt item by item with the customer, making sure that the customer knew what was what, and confirming that everything was right and present. So simple, but how many times have we all gotten wrong to-go orders elsewhere? All it takes is a little time and concern.  THE VERDICT I will be back. I do recommend. This is a gem of a place.  Parking in the back and on the side.

eaDg6Wl5FOAWEdHwiesxyg.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE this place!!! Everything about this place is amazing, the workers, the food, the location! The workers are so friendly and always so welcoming, sometimes they even remember your order :) the food here is exceptional. It's fresh, the portions are very generous. Definitely one of my favorite lunch spots in Phoenix!   They also have a drive thru where you can order food or pick up your call in order which is great for those in a rush!

P_HUv_UPf-RmzQ5J2wj7Hg.text: This place is great - the staff is friendly and the food is much better than chain restaurants like Samurai Sam's. I've only eaten here once, but my co-workers used to be regulars before we started working remote.  Sadly, the owner said the new apartment next door was built over most of their parking spaces and they have been struggling to keep regular customers as a result. It'd be a shame to let such a great place go to waste, so I highly recommend that you support their business!

95S5SDN7HaGiVSAttDymbA.text: Absolutely the best fast paced little Japanese restaurant/take out! I. First time ever walking in was busy so they had people standing on the side giving pre orders which was amazing. Their menu is so hard to choose from because they have so many great delicious selections. I tried their lunch special as a suggestion by the order taker which was the white panko chicken with a spring roll and rice. When the food came out (not even 10 min.) My plate was overly full with chicken and rice. It was soo good. I couldn't even finish it all so I gladly took it home. I was greeted not only when I walked in but also when I left! Since then I have always gone here as one of my weekly meals. Give it a try! You'll love it.

9ZcPrJvNvkDidB4qsC_jnQ.text: Shame on me for walking by on numerous occasions and not taking notice.   If this keeps up people are going to think I'm some type of dunce who thinks Asian food is found at food courts in the local mall!  I finally strolled in and decided to try them out. Upon walking in you won't find any fancy decor, but you will find staff that is friendly, courteous, and more than happy to explain anything on the menu.  I finally decided to grab the Japanese chicken curry bowl which was a little over $5 and definitely not lacking in size or flavor.   The owner is a lovely lady who has told me about living in Arizona all of her life and a few other details. She's an absolute gem and I am looking forward to trying out more of the food here.
