VNLgm1Tb1MdqNjwg4IUang.text: Love their teriyaki chicken bowl with white meat! So delicious! The gyosa is also very very good. The staff is very friendly!

lqGnqT1E_6V7wxqyI1WSzA.text: Three words: Panko Chicken Bowl.   It was easily the best cheap lunch I've had since I've starting working downtown. The chicken was tasty and the rice was perfect. It is a small location, but they have seating outside for nice days or nice evenings.

9Xzi2v-N7yk5eeE0crLIlg.text: I absolutely LOVED this place. I had never been before and was expecting it to be your run of the mill teriyaki/Katsu place. How wrong I was.   I went in with my roommate and was immediately welcomed by their cashier Angelica. She was very helpful and walked us through the menu letting us know what the favorites were. I ordered the all white meat teriyaki lunch special. Came with salad, rice, chicken and two egg rolls for $9.   I sat down and before my meal was brought to me a kind old Asian woman came up to us and started conversation. Turns out she was the owner! Betsy was her name. Betsy was so kind and took care of us like her own children while making jokes and telling us the tale of the restaurant. Her daughter Lynne was working as well and she was just as kind and hospitable as her mother. I didn't feel like I was at a restaurant, I felt as if I were at their home. I've never been treated better.  The food was delicious. Chicken was juicy and tender. Everything was amazing. The people were lovely. I loved it. I highly recommend it.

0M7bEQVWOWluYHTpihdgow.text: The food is tasty and reasonably priced for what you get, but the best part is the service.  Incredibly kind people who treat you like a guest in their home.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Fin - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Panko fish and salad

j7aP-5fxApG9EEHUL78MGg.text: I love this place. It's affordable, fast, and delicious. I can easily grab a quick lunch and be back at work with time to spare. The sunomono (cucumber salad) teriyaki chicken, panko chicken, and tempura shrimp are all worth trying as you won't be disappointed.  The best part is the prices are affordable!

mtHzFqx_GWJJuKHgbnkTvw.text: Best place ever! The ONLY place I ever get sweet and sour chicken from their food is to die for! Haven't had the chance to stop in lately but I will soon! :) I have been dining here from rarely to frequently since 2008 and try to make sure I get to visit them at Matsuri every year I can not wait to stop in again soon I can already taste the sweet and sour chicken maybe I'll even get some of their delicious teriyaki chicken or beef too! Aside from that the service is fantastic even during a rush the wait is minimal! Honestly the staff here is some of the nicest people you'll ever meet!

C1wXld9fB_tQq5uFGd9GzA.text: This spot was always a regular drop for me when I was spent time studying for the GRE at the library. From what I've heard, this place has been around for quite a while which is a testament to the food they serve. It's important to know that this place isn't authentic Japanese, it's American Japanese, so prepare your taste buds accordingly. So far, this is the only place that I've found in Phoenix that serves Japanese curry. This isn't like hot sauce over a dish, this is the real deal.  As far as the food goes, it definitely hits the spot and is always sure to please. My usual tends to be the chicken curry. They really know how to pack in the flavor and make a portion that's not too big and not too small. My only complaint is that they tend to go a bit over on the onions. Another thing to pick up while you're there is their Japanese soda. I forget the name of it, but it comes in a glass bottle and it has a glass ball that rolls around inside. It's refreshing and fun to drink as well. The sushi here is kinda "eh", but it fills you up and chances are that if you're eating there you're not looking for top quality sushi.  My impression of the place is that it's family owned by the women that work there. The older one is really friendly and makes sure that you're enjoying your meal after she serves it to you. You can tell that they really appreciate your patronage and want you to come back. It's always a good thing to know that the owners of a restaurant are passionate and take pride in what they do and treat it as more than just a job.  It's been a while since I've been here, but I really need to swing by again. Some people would probably just brush this place off as some small food hut on a street corner. That would be a huge mistake. This place is like the Yoda of Phoenician restaurants in that it reminds you that, "Size matters not."

YHDhKBmzIoPmggyiRn6-RA.text: On my first and only visit to this restaurant I experienced a rare level of genuinely kind and friendly service.   I want to go back for no other reason than the world needs the Blue Fins to keep some remnants of good old service with a smile. When delivered correctly, as Blue Fin does it, you realize that too many places are overdoing it by investing hundreds of thousands of dollars in appearances. This place is a good model for any restaurant owner/manager who is struggling with getting their troops to provide more than sub-par service...  Oh, and I almost forgot about the food. Priced right, tasted fresh, and worth a return trip.

u0GYtQqB2kCWPv9OQlyfrQ.text: This place is small with an large patio area. They have some ok teriyaki white chicken(needs more sauce kind of dry) and terribly flavorless chicken fried rice. The service was quick and nice but I wouldn't recommend dining there as it seems to be heavy traffic for drunks and homeless people (unless people watching of sadness is your thing)so you would be best to pick up instead.  I doubt I go back since the place is only so so at best for two of my favorite things. The crab puffs were nice though.

Nk-epiBSh_25zXlCQV6xxQ.text: Japanese fast food made to order for you by a lovely Chinese family.  You will be welcomed warmly and their hospitality will make you feel like you are having dinner at their home.  There are so many menu options here besides the tried and True teriyaki chicken! I'd recommend giving this place another try if you did not find the teriyaki to your liking (i personally don''t care for as much sauce on mine).  The panko fish dish could hold its own with the fish at any fish n chips or fried fish joint in town - beautifully textured and fried crispy outside, tender and moist inside.  Served on a bed of rice which to me is the perfect accompaniment to fried food in lieu of frenchfries.  All of the menu items are pictured on the wall to aid in your decision making.  Friendly affordable unpretentious Asian fast food, nothing more nothing less.  Located right across the street from the Central/McDowell Road light rail stop.  Would be the ideal place to get a bite to eat or a takeout order to go on your way to the ballpark for a weeknight game, or before hitting the streets for a First Friday artwalk.  Open till 6:30 pm Monday-Friday.

W2G9ZA8V9GBhEtgx5ilV2Q.text: Panko chicken pretty good, gotta use alot of sauce to give it some flavor. If you want straight out flavor get the teriyaki bowl but stay away from the combo unless you want a massive amount of salad. Good service and nice people!

md-DgC0FyYc0ttfRo1cPLQ.text: I was in the mood for chicken teriyaki so the BFF & I decided to give Blue Fin a try today before the Suns game. From the looks of it, one would expect a dingy little hole in the wall, but it's actually very clean inside. I secretly did a happy dance when I saw shakers of Japanese chili powder and black sesame seeds on each table.. two of my favorite condiments!   As we approached the counter, we were greeted by a cheerful and helpful lady, whom I later deduced is the owner's daughter. My friend asked which dishes were the most popular and she said, "chicken teriyaki, panko chicken, pork katsu and chicken curry." I ordered the (dark meat) chicken teriyaki combo (comes w/ rice & salad) since that was my craving at the time and the BFF ordered 1/2 chicken 1/2 beef teriyaki combo (it's not on the menu, but the lady was nice enough to accomodate the request).   Our heaping plates arrived a few minutes later and we hungrily dug in. After the first bite, I realized I was kind of disappointed by the chicken teriyaki because the meat was very dry and it was heavily marinated in sauce. I think they gave me white meat, but we were short on time and the lady was busy serving others so I didn't bother asking. The BFF enjoyed his beef & chicken combo which doesn't surprise me since he's very easy to please when it comes to food.    I ate a few more bites so I wouldn't starve during the game and packed up the rest for the BFF to take home. Oh yeah, the salad was OK. Nothing special about it, but I should have figured it wouldn't be since it was only an additional $.80 from a regular teriyaki bowl.   The lady working was not only very nice & helpful when we ordered, but she also went above and beyond what one would expect from a fast food type place. She asked us once or twice if we're doing OK, asked if we needed more rice and as we were about to toss our plates, she offered to do it for us. I also noticed she was just as friendly to the other patrons.. even offered a guy a sample of the chicken teriyaki because he didn't know what to order.   I'd really rate the food at 3 stars, but added an extra for the super nice lady. I'd give something else a try the next time I'm in the area just because she was *that* nice.

y25eLs-1jK-M3TBC9xesCA.text: I found this place back when I was working in the downtown area. Always in a rush for lunch and the traffic from everyone getting lunch in the area this place was perfect.   I always love Japanese comfort food. Katsu chicken is always a favorite especially with a little miso soup. I love the great staff there, always friendly and helpful. The older staff is always up beat and friendly and give me a sense of security as it reminds me of my grandma.   I definitely recommend this place to everyone, way better than any of those "blah blah bowl" chains.

GvSVl3md75TGosHoz1yZCQ.text: Cute little place with both outdoor  (with misters) and indoor seating.  Excellent teriyaki and salad.  Very attentive owner and staff.  Large portions and great prices $5.49 & we could easily have split one.  Next time, we will, and we'll try some of the super inexpensive appetizers...pot stickers, egg rolls.  A fresh healthy meal.

OK6SwfFFJO9017etQZO9UA.text: I just recently moved up here to Phoenix and was looking for something good to eat. I started looking through things on Yelp and found this place. it took me forever to find it and I called and the lady helped me find it. Well I definitely found it. I went and the lady working was so friendly and helped me pick out what to eat. And the found was delicious!!!!  I had the number 1. I definitely recommended it to anyone.

qPXpUrVmiwmsekgr_-701A.text: YUMMY-cheap-FAST.  Looking for a tasty bowl of chicken teriyaki?  You'll find it at the Blue Fin.  The chicken is slightly wood-fired in the flavor department & perfectly sauced with teriyaki.  This place tops the charts in the speed category, you won't wait longer than 5 minutes for your order and they have a drive through....if you're in a hurry, it's a win-win situation.  Lastly, they package their "to go" orders in the typical plastic t-shirt bags that every other place uses HOWEVER, Blue Fin bags sport the nifty little 70's smiley face icon (which I am a big fan of)  along with the slogan "Have A Nice Day!"  Try Blue Fin!

jybhuw_7gX4su37hYbv_gQ.text: Stopped here for the first time last night and was very pleasantly surprised. I had the teriyaki bowl and edemame, both were great. Very nice staff. I'll definitely be a regular customer now.

qq-baITN8B5WfxcAuofrPQ.text: Food was ok (3 star), but the service was 5 star so I gave them 4 star overall rating. This place is really popular. The workers know many of the customers by name. The place was clean and prices were great. Talk about fast... I ordered my food, paid, and by the time my change was returned, the meal was ready and they had already got me a table. You can tell they really care about the customer here.

bGNA8K9XMPXsN0-_pBKmmw.text: I tried this place, along w/ several co-workers based on the recommendation of another co-worker as we were working at the Phx Art Museum and it was within walking distance. Wanted a light lunch, so ordered a veggie rice bowl. Veggies ended up having all the life cooked out of them(as if boiled for 30 mins), and the non-descript sauce just made this dish an unappetizing mush of heavily overcooked, flavorless veggies and soupy rice. Absolutely awful. I took the rice bowl back to the counter and told that it really was pretty bad, and they sweetly offered me another menu item of my choice even if the price was higher-  so I'll definitely give the counter ladies kudos for customer service. I chose to have the teriyaki chicken bowl as a replacement. The teriyaki bowl was brought out to me shortly after, but unfortunately after taking the first bite, I found that the chicken tasted like straight charcoal. Not like teriyaki, not like chicken, but straight acrid charcoal. I haven't tried any of their other dishes and they may be absolutely delicious, but after two strikes on two simple dishes in one visit, I can't see myself wasting time by visiting again.

N4B2p0HrsY39I7ljIhaxqA.text: Friendly quick service, veggie options, accommodating to any requests, great food, reasonable prices. My new fav place downtown.

-pACFX9kbWvrRhjtZcOOgQ.text: Took a feel bites of my Teriyaki Chicken and had to throw it out.  Super sweet.  Diabetics...beware!!

RdB1QzKRELrLxqNdXjUVYg.text: This place is really great for teriyaki.  In fact it is really the only place worth going for teriyaki.  First of all - it is really very inexpensive (lunch for two under 20 - easily). Second of all - the service is great because it is family run - you see the same people there everytime.  The food is really good - and just hits the spot when you have a hankering for teriyaki.  My only complaint would be the hours- bums me out when I want teriyaki for dinner and they are already closed.

qcKb3AmjU33NfER4IiNXNw.text: The food was fine on my only visit to Blue Fin, when my son and I stopped in on a hot, off peak summer afternoon following a library assignment., but what  we remember most was the elderly Japanese lady who refilled our drinks, took several moments to chat, and repeatedly referred to my son as "Son". Or possibly "San" - I'm not entirely sure.   She just had a gentle grace about her, from another culture, and another era, that made a lasting impression on my teenager. That was three or four months ago, and he still brings her up every so often.   "Hey Dad. Remember that lady at Blue Fin?"  "What's that?"  Oh, who am I kidding.  She made an impression on me too.

-ypKCAtl5gFVHKG3MoevHg.text: I go to Blue Fin for lunch with friends almost every other month.  Locally owned and the little Japanese lady (we call her "mama" san) thanking everyone for coming and making sure your cup is full is awesome and one of the main reasons I keep going back for more.  Food is great for Japanese fast food.  I just tried their coconut shrimp and it was awesome!  If you are hungry try the terriyaki chicken , rice and salad combo, yum!!

ilMOmY4KwMqMaDnJWZdUUA.text: just grabbed lunch there today. Had the all white meat Teriyaki bowl. It is dry and flavorless. Is it really chicken? Turkey or pigeon I think, well at least it's some bird flesh from what I can tell by looks. Sauce is flat and lacks flavor. No thrills about a bowl with a little rice and a large portion of meat. No garnish nothing. Brought it home and fed it to my dog. She enjoyed it. I want be returning and I'm disappointed that all of you think it's so great, the place doesn't even have atmosphere to like.

mKAl8-j_5_HUS6a4Tep0Yw.text: A flawless lunch! Just steps from Burton Barr Library, where I was at for a training. I wanted a quick bite and I got it. Seemingly a family owned business where the matron worked the room making sure a guests had everything they needed.   It is a Japanese fast food restaurant. The selection is wide, fast service, inexpensive, and delicious. If only I work in downtown, I'd visit several times a week. They cater to vegetarians and carnivores alike. My lunch was filling and pleasant. Next time I'm in the area, I'll return.

CM-MvpVV-35MXOVckzosiA.text: If you want a quick and affordable meal then this is your place. Parking is slim during lunch but they have a take out pick up window, so definitely call in your order. If you want to sit in for lunch, seating is also slim. Around dinner time it's empty and there's parking available.  Service was fast during the lunch rush but very impersonal. During the slow dinner hours they're alot friendlier.  Food was fairish, not great but not terrible. I've had the egg rolls, edamame, Vegetable Yakisoba Bowl (wheat noodles) with Chicken Teriyaki, the seaweed salad, and the sunomono (cucumber salad), as well as the mini mochis.  The seaweed salad and the mini mochis are my favorite things to get here but I learned that they are not made in-house, they are special ordered from somewhere else.

eRI2NCjnnte-zwAzFaHmrg.text: This downtown staple always hits the spot! Perfectly prepared and executed meals, options for all dietary concerns, friendly family staff, cute interior setup, and reasonable prices for the portions! Super easy to call ahead or take to go~

oBCZfmbp764uvrTwNn67fA.text: Best teriyaki chicken I have ever had! I have fallen in love with this place and the people that own it! Every customer that came in was greeted with a smile and looked like they were regulars. ALSO, I don't have to go all the way to Oahu for Aloha Maid drinks!

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Fin - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Aloha Fruit Drinks

Yc-91ARg96U5H1VOcJknsg.text: Terrible customer service. I recieved the wrong order and called them to let them know I got the wrong food. I had said the wrong meal # but said "vegetable curry". Despite weather I should have payed better attention to the menu #s or the cashier should have picked up that I said the rite item with the wrong #, I didn't deny I said the wrong #.  A asked if I could pick up my correct order with is just plain rice with vegetables and sauce, probably costs $0.50 to them to make. Instead of being told "sure no problem ", I was told I need to be put on hold so the very young girl that couldn't have been more then 10 they had working could ask the manager.  Also there was not one but two children behind the counter operating the register and taking orders. All I wanted was the rite food. I said CURRY!!!!!  What I got was plain noodles and veggies. Hardly worth the money. I tried to make the best of it and eat it, but it was terrible.  All they gave me was ONE package told soy sauce.  It's not even the rite sauce for this "food". And it didn't help.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Fin - Phoenix, AZ, United States. I couldn&#39;t stomach any more. I threw this away.

q1SlPogHFVycGN0-gNfklg.text: Been going to Blue Fin for many many years. The food is what you would expect for fast food but it is very tasty. Service is very quick and establishment is very clean. It's a great place to get a quick lunch For a great price.. The insideHas limited seating as well as outside.

WZHx3owbN6OTUee-fqGH4A.text: Clean restaurant! Good food. Reasonably priced. What elese can you ask for. Chicken teriyaki bowl is good value and they have a small assortment of pre-made sushi rolls. Good lunch spot.

HLEo7z70vGeL7vPp1Q2BmQ.text: TASTY neighborhood eatery. ALWAYS a reliable choice for lunch or an early dinner. Caring, family ownership. CLEAN and well maintained. Their Terriyaki Chicken is SUPERB !!

jNERMq0p3DqlGpKo1PiD2w.text: This is my favorite restaurant in the whole city! Always delicious & the staff is always friendly. It's the kind of place where they remember your name & order. My go-to is the panko chicken bowl.

Dc7bjrCGT6BXyYw9UmOoUw.text: I remember this place being the best place in town! My mom would bring some home and we all enjoyed. Sometimes my dad would join the fight and get the food, too. Now that I am an adult, I would love to come here and eat here everyday. The salad dish is great! Oh, the dressing for the salad is perfect! I have to ask for more dressing, but that is okay. Can't remember if there is charge...anyway. Must try! Thank you, Shawna

Ajf93E9w3_48te4JsPjnCw.text: I wish I knew about this place sooner. Their service is very quick. Food is what you pay for. I like how the server and owner know who their regular customers are. Very friendly costumer service and food is decent.

-q3eFSRnSW4wNlVrgEZ9tg.text: One day after a training at work, my coworker and I decided to give this place a try.  We were starving and wanted to see what this place was all about.  The inside was very retro, and not very appealing.  They used styrofoam boxes and stuff even if you dined in, which was odd and not very environmentally friendly.  The place was a little dirty, bits and pieces of food could be found at all the vacant tables.  The service was also slow, their wasn't many people when I ordered, so I do not know what's the hold up.  The lady in the front was super friendly and helped me decide what I wanted since it was my first time.  I ordered this bowl of noodles with a bunch of veggies.  Kinda like lo-mein.    Overall a good place, the food is good as well.  This place would be great for taking out in my opinion.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Fin - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delicious noodles!

yUIS9M3OEtOUz1ht5FVwKA.text: Like a few other reviewers, meh... I had the chicken vegetable teriyaki rice bowl.  The chicken was rubbery and kinda slimy.  The veggies weren't cut well and way over cooked.  The teriyaki sauce was really salty.  I eat at least 2 rice bowls a week from places all over the valley and this was by far in the bottom of my list for quality.  The service was good and the lady at the counter was nice.  I won't be back.

gdhdYVquEky8Sq3nATn0fg.text: I've always seen Blue Fin at the Matsuri festival but never tried their food because of lines and time constraints. Finally made it to their brick and mortar and I can't believe I've never been in before. The teriyaki chicken looks a bit one-note from pictures, but there's a nice grilled flavor to the chicken that caught me by surprise. The value here is great, I got a super filling meal with a nice mix of protein and salad on my plate for less than $10, including even the veggie spring rolls that I added on. The family that runs this place was so nice as well. I'll definitely be back to try out the beef and the fish that everybody talks about.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Fin - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Panko fish
Photo of Blue Fin - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork egg roll
Photo of Blue Fin - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Teriyaki beef bowl

p8fnui0kvxaj2msls8dt1g.text: Meh... No to the Yakisoba Those were some weak noodles The Teriyaki Chicken was tastey but can't stand up to Grilled Avenue's Chicken

RLzRZY583Tgo3MQek7_lUQ.text: The owner is a sweet heart, they have the best mochi, and I can't get enough of the curry chicken. My wife and I love this place!

Uhqe-ItaSK21ROAeY2vJAw.text: Love this place! They're super fast, the food is good, and everyone is really friendly. I order here at least once a week.

47JuHhM9xpRiwgmLvvfryQ.text: Blue Fin is a family owned business and has that nice vibe. Everyone is very friendly, and if you come often, they get to know you. I came with a friend who frequents this restaurant, and we had a nice lunch with a few other girls. The food was pretty good. I ordered the panko fish plate, which comes with two pieces of fried, breaded fish served over rice with sauce on the side. The fish was a little dry, but the sauce helped with that. They definitely give a lot of rice, which was enough for me to take home for another meal. Overall, I'd say that the food wasn't my favourite, but I really enjoyed the friendly atmosphere.

cscErc2hSX6INWD-53k-TQ.text: The employees are very nice! This review is strictly just about the yakisoba. It was tasteless and seemed like it was boiled in water then served. The vegetables and tofu tasted also boiled.

112eUxMhVAV2g_Tk4c8o8A.text: Really wanted to like this place  Maybe its just me, but the past couple of times I visited Blue Fin, the food lacked flavor and just wasn't very good. The Blue Finn offers daily weekday lunch specials at very reasonable prices.  The Staff is friendly and accommodating, that's why I feel terrible for having to say the food just isn't good.  On this visit I ordered the Teriyaki Chicken.  It was nothing special. The chicken was plentiful but lacking in flavor and seemed to have been quickly immersed in sauce, but no grilling or carmelization.  Plenty of rice and salad-very filling but not as satisfying.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Fin - Phoenix, AZ, United States

HfYIGMoFXRpyAG8cI1Xr9w.text: This restaurant is a perfect example of why I give my money to local business owners.  This is a sparsely decorated gem in Midtown Phoenix. In an area full of lunch only, counter order spaces, one would think this wouldn't be welcome. I love a rice bowl every now and then and this one is extremely high quality and stocks every type of rice bowl imaginable. I've had the Oyako and Teriyaki both multiple times and they are delcious. You definitely wait a few minutes for your food, and that is a good thing because it means they are not mass producing food and waiting for people to order it, like Tokyo Express does.   Good food alone though, won't garner a five-star review for a rice bowl. What pushes Blue Fin over the top is the ownership. The little old Japanese lady who owns and runs the restaurant during lunch time is one of the absolute nicest people I've ever encountered. She welcomes every customer, and speaks to you in a genuine family like manner. She does not come across as fake or ass-kissish. I just get a calm, warm, and welcome feeling from this woman when I come in here.  It's not even just her either. Her staff always looks happy, and has run of the soda fountain, water, lemonade, etc. Everyone just seems to be happy. It's True that if you take care of your staff, they make your customers happy as well.  Many other places make me feel so unwelcome around here at lunch time, but I can always count on Blue Fin to treat me like family and give me a solid rice bowl.

zE9EI-JEuOxviaHQJXcVAw.text: Probably the nicest restaurant proprietors in The Valley. These people are AWESOME.   Blue Fin is a great lunch place...healthy, fast, inexpensive and tasty. The atmosphere is simple and clean.   The only bad thing about this restaurant is that they're not open late enough, and they remain closed on the weekends.   But again, the number one draw to this place is clearly the people. The owners are wonderful, and so is every other person who works there. I can't say enough!

EB4ulKRvlN5ZdsT4XDH6kQ.text: I'm a teriyaki fiend.  I buy all the expensive kinds of bottled teriyaki sauce from AJ's I make my own in all different ways I try every place that has teriyaki sauce on stuff  I was SUPER pysched to try Blue Fin  It was good. Great.  Few suggestions though.  I like spicy teriyaki sauce.  They serve a "spicy" version, but its not a different sauce.  It's just the regular chicken teriyaki with some red chile sauce drizzled.  I would have preferred just to put the red pepper from the shaker on top.... but alas.  Live and learn.  The women who work here are the CUTEST THINGS EVER!  They're sooooooooo sweet.  I loved them.  So yeah, this place is pretty darn great.

buvnLHPOd4Pzn_ZNVaW_lA.text: I hang my head in shame that I did not make this my go-to Teriyaki joint sooner.  I knew of it, I remember eating it at the Matsuri Festival years ago, but for some reason I just did not bother to stop into the restaurant. I'm so glad I did, I now make the drive down Central ave at least once a week to get my fix.  Food is fresh and plentiful. Staff are insanely nice.  And they don't mess around. You will literally get a PILE of chicken in your bowl. Delicious, hot, steamy, falling-out-everywhere chicken. A mountain of chicken, if you will.  I hate that they're not open on the weekends, but I just couldn't bring myself to dock a star for that.

9KgGNrwxnIDYLbB9zoEmpA.text: Been wanting to try this place. Casual, clean and friendly. My partner and I were really hungry so we tried a number of items and loved them all!  I especially loved the Japanese Curry Chicken. I will go back and recommend this restaurant to friends!

YK0vN2Gu5RyiKGjWt28C0w.text: The price is right, the food is all excellent.  The Panko white fish is what I had today, and had the Chicken Terryaki bowl in the past.  The women who work here are so so sweet, they are always so sweet to my son, which is worth 2 stars to me.  Every time you leave, they thank you for your business, and that just makes the food you burp up taste even better.    Plus when you are done eating you can walk across the street to the library and get your learn on.  I think what you will gather by my reviews is I like simple places that are cheap.  I like the fou fou stuff on occasion as well, but I like working class type people to make me my food, because they usually do it with love and passion.   Unless you're talking about Filibertos, where I found a rusty staple in my food once.

TAOVJRcz1F-J17iR3AAckw.text: I enjoy blue fin, I don't remember how I found the place back in 2010 or so, but it was the first place I tried Mochi. I really like the texture and taste of the Teriyaki Chicken, a signature safe dish and good medium to compare to other places. In fact I liked it so much that I've stuck to it. I'm from the North valley and there are tons of unique food options in the downtown area catering to all tastes. Blue Fin is one of those place I make an open slot for.  I'd say give it a shot, and dig it.

DxCVd8hCJZBn0GjbE9uwAA.text: I can't say much about this place because I do the same damned thing every time.  Pull up to the drive through window, smile at the nice lady, order a teriyaki combo or two and some rolls, and peel out with my food in two minutes or less.  I can't imagine it's the toughest thing in the world to make consistently good teriyaki, but I'll tell you what, those people are friendly every damned time I roll through.  And the food is always still hot and delicious when I plop down on my sofa to dig in.  Oh, and the salad dressing for the combo salad is yum.  God, I think this place might have been around back when I was in high school.  Way to keep it rolling!  Five stars, baby!

W0p2jC9OrjJIkj1JjnicbQ.text: I've offically became a frequent flier here.   The staff is bare, but friendly. The quality is unbeatable for the price and it's within spitting distance to the library.   They honor the ASU SunDevil Suncard which impresses me.  It's a hidden gem. I cannot get enough of this place.

Fo6nZBDOjMzLL74uKqCaLQ.text: Love love love Blue Fin. The staff are the nicest people ever. I love the Panko fish bowl.

iYJhlZaczJ42A1NMmqmzEg.text: Extremely mediocre food, served by delightful, friendly people.That's the best way to describe this place.  We ordered California Rolls, and found them small, dry and not flavorful. Much like Grocery Store packaged sushi.  The edamame was the worst I have ever had. It was obviously just 'nuked' and some of the beans had white areas on them from frost burn in their freezer. Really, avoid these!  The teriyaki chicken bowls, which we were expecting based on the reviews here to be delicious, were only . . . "so so" at best. The meat was chewy, there was some gristle thrown in for good measure, and in general, it was a big disappointment. I went in on a Groupon type special and felt that we got our money's worth, but just barely.  On the positive side, the serving size was nice on the bowl, and the women serving/making the food were very sweet and friendly. I hope their business does well, but I assure Yelpers that it will require them to upgrade their quality or this place won't be there long.

AzVvjL7dfoJr1kEET16-3A.text: Oh man...if I lived in Phoenix, I would be here all the time. I stayed at a hotel right near here and tried it, not expecting too too much. But then I saw the awesome looking teriyaki bowls on the wall and I grew much more optimistic. I should have been let down...but I most certainly wasn't.   The price was fantastic, and the portion size was fantastic. Not only that...but it tasted really really goooooood! I wish I could have had the time to go back to try more stuff as the beef teriyaki that I got was fantastic.

XW-75NFMi_mLQqTm2MqoUQ.text: I love this place. I'd consider moving back to Arizona just for The Blue Fin (not really but maybe). Really really good food, very decent prices, quite healthy portions...  only cons: close early no weekends  But great sushi, great Japanese food, etc etc etc

bAMhwiWbrF7LTMN4fF-2Ow.text: Maybe I went there on an off-day, or because I got there right before closing, my chicken teriyaki to-go was dry as a bone. The rice underneath was moist and I appreciate the huge helping of salad, but the star of the meal was not up to par.   ... I went back this week and I have to upgrade my review. I went during lunchtime (around 1pm) and got the chicken teriyaki bowl with salad again. A coworker had been telling me to give it another try because he's always had good meals there. This time the chicken was fresh and moist, very tender and delicious. Even though I'm petite and the portion was gigantic, I managed to finish all except 3 pieces. All of my coworkers were impressed.   My coworker got the yellow curry bowl, once with chicken and a second tme with beef. He really likes it, and I took a look and saw it's made similar to the way my parents make it, which means it might become a comfort food for me.  I also met the owner Betsy and her daughter while I was picking up the order. They were really nice, friendly people. That had nothing to do with my change in review, I should add.

eJQWEUuvuHWadx4wp-kx5g.text: I need to update my review of Blue Fin. This place absolutely rocks; that's probably why you can find me eating lunch here 4 out of 5 weekdays, seriously. I haven't ever had a bad experience here after finding this gem and cannot speak higher of everything about they provide. Service, quality and freshness of food, as well as value, cannot be found elsewhere.

4PVQ_4CZPv35lWO9rX9R9w.text: I don't write many reviews but I thought that Blue Fin deserved another one.  Probably the best customer service I have ever had and some of the best teriyaki in the valley.  No corporate BS, just a family business that genuinely cares about its customers and people that genuinely want to be there.  I would recommend this restaurant to everyone!

gu6Yyz88e4OZ4uMpurUBEg.text: Best panko, Katsu, bento box style lunches in the metro valley. good location right off the cultural stop along the light rail on central. Family owned prices are super reasonable It's one of those places you crave and wish it were closer to where you live.   I try to stop by this place whenever I can - don't miss it.

rdVQbWhKgbu3Fam4Z7jUWg.text: Blue Fin is within walking distance of work so I go once a week, I'd go more but that'd just be silly.  Speaking of silly, I order the same thing every week and all of the staff knows it!!   'The Healthy Special' - chicken teriyaki (white meat), veggies (carrots, broccoli, cabbage) on brown rice with a really amazing Iced Tea.  Delicious down to the last bite!  Locally owned and the staff goes out of their way to be as friendly as possible. Always smiling and always happy to see me.   It's also right next to a light rail stop which is OH-so convenient!

bJzEoV2Omu6A_DfEAnSJHQ.text: I really wanted Asian food for lunch and to get out of the office on foot. Lucky for me, The Blue Fin met both requirements. (Sorry, I do not consider Pei Wei Asian food) I had heard about this place and always wondered about the dinky place with the blue awning.   First off, I was impressed for a mom-and-pop place with a drive-thru window, it was pretty immaculate. I noticed while sitting down to wait for my order, there wasn't a crumb on any empty table. The woman behind the counter was friendly and seemed to know a lot of the people coming through.   As for the food, I was pleasantly surprised when I tasted my chicken teriyaki vegetable bowl with brown rice. The chicken wasn't drenched in an overly sweet sauce like a lot of Japanese places. It had this smoky flavor like it had been on the grill, not something I'm used to with teriyaki. I certainly didn't mind it. Also, the cabbage, carrots, etc. had some flavor to them and they didn't taste like they had been overcooked or terribly greasy like at a Panda Express. I felt full afterward, but not in a gross "I ate too many onion rings" kind of way. The bowl cost about $6.50 which I consider reasonable. The place also has a watercooler where you are free to fill 'er up. When the cashier wasn't busy, she came around and grabbed my cup to refill it for me. Nice touch.   Now, I gave it four stars not because I'd call it a four-star restaurant but for what it offers considering it's "fast food" and for the good manners. I'll definitely come again. I could see meeting someone there for lunch or hogging a table just to read a book in between noshing on teriyaki.

S5J3nn0bC6DXhDzb-0sUDg.text: The food is average but tasty, but I the service is outstanding.  Our server was extremely nice and attentive and competent, and the place was jumping with the lunch rush.  I'd go back.

Zc3dQhdY6VATxOdMF4PYeQ.text: I hadn't checked Yelp before going here, but it's on the light rail and I've been wanting to eat here for weeks. It just so happened that I was split between two offices today and Blue Fin was in the middle. So, I exited off McDowell and was treated to the amazing aromas of BF.   Upon entering, I'm greeted by the nicest lady I might have ever met. She admires my plaid jacket. (BTW, there's a Yelp sticker on the door!) After reviewing the menu--which has a good selection of choices--I decide on the panko fish over white rice. That wonderfully kind lady was sad to see me leave because she wouldn't get to see if I liked my food. Waiting at the LR station, I was glad I picked up an extra pair of chop sticks because some crazy-eyed man was looking at my bag. Although it had been about 10 minutes from the time I received my food to the time I walked back into my office, the food hadn't really cooled down all that much. Nice! The fish was super crispy on the outside yet marvelously moist inside. And the rice was good too.   I'll definitely be back, kind lady. And hopefully I'll be able to eat there with you so you know how much I appreciate great food and expectational service.

XaVgX_4RahQu_TVn93mCxw.text: The Blue Fin is my favorite Teriyaki stop in the valley.    To begin, the service here is awesome!  For such a casual restaurant, they really know how to make you feel welcome.  I absolutely love the food here too.  Great appetizers, spring rolls, inari, sunomono, etc.  Being vegetarian, I always order the same...Steamed Vegetable Bowl.  For the money, you get a TON of food here.  The teriyaki sauce is perfect, not too sweet like some of those chain places.  Did I mention that the service here is the best?  The only thing wrong with The Blue FIn; they are not opened on the weekends, Monday through Friday only.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Fin - Phoenix, AZ, United States. GIANT Veggie Bowl, with extra veggies

dPSp9qbkFkBCJMtxWhtCSA.text: My husband and I discovered Blue Fin about two years ago and we just LOVE eating there!  Their food is made fresh when you order it. It's priced fairly cheap, considering how great their food tastes!  Their signature dish is panko fish and panko chicken. So, don't be surprised if you show up and order one of these dishes and they tell you that they're sold out. Which goes to show how fresh their food really is!  Keep in mind that they're only open during the week and until about 6:30pm  And since the light rail was finished downtown, getting to Blue Fin is a little tricky, but it's worth the trip!

oB-9h4MB26ftzj0jJn0cfA.text: I am a huge Teriyaki chicken fan, so I tried this place based on Yelp reviews.  My fellow yelp'ers weren't far off the mark.  I ordered the white meat Teriyaki Chicken bowl with brown rice, along with a pork egg roll and a large drink.  The meal arrived at my table quickly.  Upon first bite, I was taken aback because the teriyaki sauces I've tried are really, really sweet.  This sauce is not as sweet, but much more flavorful.  The egg roll was good, but the sweet/sour sauce it came with was better than I've ever had.  Simple, sweet, and not gooey or gloopy.    One of the owners (a wonderfully pleasant aging Japanese woman) came to my table and offered me chopsticks and hot mustard -- we had a delightful conversation wherein she explained that the chicken is hormone-free and char-grilled over pumice stones, and their sauces are home-made from family recipes.  They also offer many healthy options, including brown rice and vegetarian dishes, and NO MSG IS ADDED!!  She was a fantastic host.    Everyone seemed to be hurrying around, but they were all doing a great job keeping the customers happy by refilling drinks, delivering orders and making conversation with the people inside and outside the shop.  All in all, a great experience.  I told the owner I would be back with my son by the end of the week, and I plan to keep my promise!  Great job, Blue Fin!

JC18BbqZgj0rGJT3L29UfA.text: Good fast food. We liked it here but it was the owner we couldn't get over. When we disagreed with her choice on politics (which she brought up) she basically called us dumb and lectured us for 30 minutes. My friend and I don't feel very comfortable eating here and if we had to, we'd get our orders to go.

CuuPa1Wf9ZkiPSdXQLAoIw.text: If you are a fan of the old tried and True meal of teriyaki chicken bowls, you will absolutely love this family own restaurant. Even though the food is spectacular, the thing that always stands out the most about The Blue Fin is the unbelievable customer service. I cannot think of a time I have been here where the owner was not behind the counter giving me her heart-felt thanks for being a customer.   The place may not look like much from the outside but just know that you will be taken care of once you are there and will have some incredible food for dine in or take out.

pzVM-lRp-iO5t5G1zbEJfw.text: Fast, friendly service during a busy work day is very appreciated.  I was a bit boring and ordered the chicken teriyaki bowl.  It was delicious.  I also ordered a large drink.  I nursed that thing all afternoon at my desk.    I look forward to returning and trying something more exciting and getting a smaller drink.

d9CTAuYJeGqSQxTKOnyALg.text: This place honestly did earned the rating given on my 1st visit! Blue Fin earned 4 stars based on the following 3 things.  1. Cleanliness!  It's nice, bright, clean and "open."  2. Lynn, an employee there, exceeded my expectations in customer service!  She was warm, friendly, conversational and very insightful as to their menu. Her helpful tips made it extremely easy for me to order! Otherwise I get easily (and admittedly) overwhelmed and would've missed my train while trying to decide what to order.   3. The food was simple, yet good. Affordable as well.  It's the perfect "train food" as far as I'm concerned. Healthy, easy to travel with and very conveniently located right next to the platform. And it's been there for 30 years to boot!  Seriously glad I stopped here!  I'll definitely return and probably add a 5th star after doing so!  Great little place!

s3T3g0Uj7KwCptrM9dwXzA.text: This place rocks! I got the Gyoza and Oyako bowl for lunch  on Tuesday and I was immediately a fan.   The gyoza is deep fried deliciousness and comes in pork or shrimp (I think? I opted for pork) and it is BOMB!   And the Oyako was amazing, grilled chicken cooked perfectly, and blended with light eggs, veggies and rice that added a sweetness to the chicken and eggs. Amazing balance in this dish. Whole meal was like $10 too, and that includes a "medium" lemonade which is actually HUGE!! Seriously, get a small lol  All in all I greatly enjoyed myseld, and the service is off the charts. They do everything they possibly can to make sure you're enjoying your meal, and all with huge smiles on their face, like they enjoy their job or something. Weird lol  GO HERE!

yzM7Q-vjQnc_x1kr8RiLOQ.text: The service at Blue Fin earns all the stars, as far as I'm concerned. There are other equally tasty (and in some cases more flavorful) places to grab a rice bowl. The service is outstandingly hospitible though; so, you can't help but leave Blue Fin with a warm fuzzy feeling toward your hosts!

xAG3tIhRx3qZY9-2_CbRLQ.text: Blue Fin has awesome Teriyaki Bowls and daily specials for under $10. The portions are large and you will even have leftovers. I am a big fan. The menu is a bit limited, but has good customer service and short wait times. Took off one star for limited seating- it is very busy and I would like to have more table space/options.

Ez0YLGxi6DtbEu4Ulud77Q.text: I stopped in one day when I first moved here and sampled a couple of things, the chicken teriyaki, the fried gyoza, and some kind of drink. Nothing was fresh, everything tasted like old fryer grease or freezerburn (except my drink). To their credit, the service was immaculate. The women who helped me was super friendly and made suggestions of things I should try on my next visit (when pigs fly). I am really amazed by the positive reviews here. Unfortunately, this place is just a couple blocks from my house so I have to deal with the nasty stench from their deep fryer when I walk to the lightrail on my way to work.

ZCdUqDT19jT2Rl5Q9ZLFUw.text: Quick, friendly, I mean really friendly, it's a family business and they want their customers to feel like part of their family... Panko fish, delicious not to greasy, sushi fresh and everything is affordable for a quick lunch. I go there once a week.

N5fu7Aaa7Ryc0mrjuDhC-w.text: After living downtown for 2 years my husband and I finally tried this place.  I got the chicken teriyaki plate. It was all I hoped it would be: tender moist tangy chicken. The salad dressing was super garlicky and a wonderful compliment to the rich teriyaki  and sticky rice.  The only reason I can't give it 5 stars is that Husband ordered the all white meat version and it wasn't nearly as succulent as mine. Granted I understand that white meat is, by definition, drier -- but even I've managed to cook a moist chicken breast so.... Regardless I am definitely going back as I really want to try some of the fried dishes. The dude next to us was just SCARFING down some sort of wonton-type things.

6PCa-IyH_Zqp8MnHBngGfg.text: So nice to have this gen across the street from my office!  The good and bad news - the sushi (spicy tuna and Cali rolls.) while they are everything I've come to expect and want from them, they are made in limited quantity.  All but once, they are sold out by the time I get there.  So, good that I know they're fresh and not sitting for days on end - bad that I don't get them when I want them.  Love the iced green tea. The teryaki chicken and veggie bowl is one of my favorites!  Everything I have ordered has been very fresh and flavorful.  Fair prices, large portions.  It's American style Japanese fast food at it's finest - and much better value than most (Yoshi, Tokyo Express, Shogun Express, etc.). Plus - it just feels better to deal with locals than a chain.

dOBBR_eg6M6-CcJbRvqQAA.text: Ordered the terriyaki beef bowl. Dry pulpish meat, worst terriyaki sauce ever- taste of pure salt and msg. not a single bit of vegetable like in the photos. Very small serving. $10 after tipping, I will go to chipotles anyday!

I4Z_1ukETHMsm70oLCE1Ww.text: I went to this little place for the first time today.  I can only say positive things about going there.  It was clean, the service friendly and efficient, the food was good.  I was impressed when Betsy, one of the owners came by to see if we were happy with our dinners. I liked the idea of wheat noodles. Finding out that they use only beta carotene veggies-no fillers like bean sprouts-and no oil in preparing them was even better news.  My fellow dinner had chicken a chicken curry which having sampled, I have to say I am going to try next time we go the Blu Fin.  My biggest surprise eating at the Blue Fin is the cheese cake they serve.  I don't profess to be a lover of cheese cake.  It never really impresses me.  It was light and the flavor was great.  Worth having for a birthday binge I am happy to report.

yyh-NJkzwnm3wIMw28L_-Q.text: I am not a huge Teriyaki fan and this place was coming up as a sushi place on Yelp for a while now but was always closed. As most of you know, there are barely any sushi places down town so when I was home for the week last week I finally had the chance to head out to this place.  I wasn't disappointed that there was barely any sushi, I decided to go with the beef teriyaki instead. Holy smokes! Super yum! I haven't had teriyaki that was this good, ever!.  I will go back more and more and stuff myself silly. Love it.  I highly recommend it.

cUEDkeElNjzX0X0RaBUTlw.text: For years I've been stopping here when in the area.  They are the nicest people and the food is awesome.   Stopped by yesterday for a quick bite after not having lunch. I was on the phone in the lot for a bit and went in at 645. I didn't even realize they close at 630 but the staff person was still serving customers and pleasant as always. The Panko Chicken is my favorite but I have had many other things also. The Panko was freshly made and my order very quickly filled.  I recommend this place to anyone hungry for fresh Asian fare!

aEAuHCxYjJp8YLeE_bT8uQ.text: A few weeks ago, an old friend and I made plans to meet up for lunch. Problem is, I essentially live in North Scottsdale and she is in Buckeye. Using Meetways.com to find a halfway point, I then took the results to Yelp to see what restaurants are in the area (I prefer to find the good local places, rather than a chain, which I'm sure is True for most Yelpers). Anyways, saw the great reviews and decided to check this place out. We both were unadventurous and ordered chicken teriyaki bowls which were of course delicious as others have said. Very nice portions too as neither of us downed the whole bowl. Where this place really shines, though is the service. An older woman, who I'm guessing must have been one of the owners as someone else mentioned, was walking around conversing with the patrons. It's a small place so she was able to check with everyone on multiple occasions during the time we were there. Her service was absolutely delightful. When I received my food first (I had ordered a couple minutes before, so my friend had just finished ordering when I got my meal), she came over to the table and informed that the young lady would not think I was rude if I started eating before she was served. A moment later, she came back with my friend's food as she told us that she "has pull around here" lol. I'm guessing that teriyaki bowl was intended for another customer, so sorry about the added wait if that's the case, random stranger. A while later she came back to give us free refills of our large drinks. I will definitely be going back when I'm in the area again, and might have to order something different. A wonderful experience that was truthfully what motivated me to actually sign up for Yelp and write a review after years of using the app as an "outsider" The only negative was that the parking is very limited, but then again I did go during the lunch rush. My friend was able to get a spot in their lot but I wound up having to park in a different lot just north of it. It was maybe only 30 feet further away, I just wasn't sure if I would be towed or not.

GW_kLe1SCx6EdMoql6lVLA.text: I went with some coworkers during lunch. I had the Teriyaki chicken bowl with vegetables. It was very good. There was a lot of people when we got there. We were able to get a table around 10 minutes so it wasn't too bad.

tSuvXOmWNR4m0wwHECoRvw.text: Solid food at a reasonable price and amazingly nice folks

bIzRHWnI2RiQqMBnxKTvCA.text: I bought a Groupon for Blue Fin a couple of years ago and never used it. However on my last trip into the city I decided that I would go and redeem it for the purchased value while I was out that way. Boy am I happy that I did!!  Quite frankly, this place impressed my socks right off. I had heard that it had some good items however I must say that is quite an understatement. Best Teriyaki in the city by far; their panko chicken is also to die for!  Bottom line: I live in south east Gilbert and have driven to eat here 3 times in the last month. Enough said.

e3ADt2huWq2qzDF2otjdSg.text: I dig going to the Blue Fin for lunch to satisfy my occasional teriyaki fix. The service is friendly and prompt, and the location allows for some people watching, since it is across the street from a light rail station.  Last time I ate here I upgraded from the teriyaki chicken and vegetable bowl to the platter. This means that it comes with salad, which is fairly simple shredded iceberg lettuce and house dressing. Unfortunately, when it's "to go", everything gets packed in the same styrofoam container, so the lettuce gets warmed up on top of the entree and isn't all that palatable. I've said it before in other reviews, warm salad = bad, chilled salad = good. Despite my salad woes, I really like the food here and have never failed to enjoy what I've ordered. And since it's always been reasonably priced, the Blue Fin is a cool little Japanese lunch spot where you can get your Teriyaki on!

t70QXTdMcsikdRXfyS_kPA.text: Best teriyaki chicken in town!  Not sure what it is about the teriyaki sauce but it's perfect! The chicken is always tender and I've never had a bite with fat on it. Even the side salad is great, this coming from a guy who doesn't care for many things green...   The owners are extremely caring and the food shows their attention to detail!  Well done!

MExmZst2pjcQkKGa3FrL_Q.text: OK, I've literally driven by this place a thousand times, never stopping because I thought it was a scary looking shack and couldn't believe that people actually ate here.  However - after a friend of mine told me that I was crazy and that the food was delicious, I had to try it.  Now I've eaten there three times this week.    I should also probably mention that I usually hate all things teriyaki - it's disgustingly over sweet and I can't understand why people like it.  BUT this place has it right - it's fresh, not out of a jar, and made by the sweetest people you'll ever talk to.  Try a chicken bowl with extra veggies and brown rice - you won't be disappointed.  And don't forget to order an eggroll - they're amazing and they come with this ridiculous ginger sauce that'll leave you craving more.

zDrch7Ny2pwre1phVU7N6Q.text: Great causal lunch spot Sushi was prepared earlier in the day and tasted a bit old. The egg rolls were great Small dining area, clean  I would return and try again

3eFWH2a3ntTP0KDDH3ek7Q.text: I was walking down central and thought I'd try this small restaurant. I'm sure glad I did. The food is great especially for the price. Best of all is the woman that works here. She'll walk by and talk to patrons. Refill your drink, get you more teriyak

KLqWvAMxwP2zpEWjeMYq9Q.text: This was horrible!!!!!!!!!! I went there because it said sushi. Ummmm no they have the box sushi that you can buy at a grocery store, so i had to get the chicken bowl. There was hardly any chicken, it was all the breading and it was disgusting. Not worth your time at all!

eUwFjwO2nOxN9Ojs-RBXBQ.text: This place is great. I love their chicken teriyaki. The ladies that seem to work here every day are incredibly kind. When ordering at Blue Fin keep in mind that when chicken cooks at high temperatures, dark meat retains moisture better and is more flavorful than breast meat. I highly recommend ordering the dark meat with their main dish. Many of the reviews below that complain about dryness or about shaved meat is commenting on the white meat teriyaki, which apparently isn't their niche. Order with dark meat and I promise you'll be back again very soon.

pz45gSC43BAb78Q4VXRrUg.text: The teriyaki is to DIE FOR! We have been coming to blue fin for years- the price, food, and service is always out of this world. Family owned and operated, friendly staff and great specials. The seaweed and the cucumber salad are both  great! Sushi is always fresh and delicious. I always love the daily special- under 8$ gets you drink, salad, rice, teriyaki chicken, and two egg rolls. LOVE BLUE FIN! We travel from outside of Buckeye Arizona almost an hour) and it is well worth it every time!

b3iya-0kiti6u55sY8s0Aw.text: Bossman has been whining ever since Shogun Express on Camelback closed a few years ago. Yogi's and Yoshi's and wherever else we tried never really cut it. A Yelp search brought up Blue Fin, and although it's a little further than normal to fetch lunch, I mentioned it to him and he agreed to try it. And glad we were!   We had the daily special ($7.29), which consisted of teriyaki chicken, rice, salad, 2 spring rolls and drink, and an order of sunomono ($1.29). Opt for all white meat (+$0.75) and brown rice (+$0.30). It was a lot of food. The salad was meh, and in the same box as the teriyaki, so it was kinda warm by the time I got back to the office (at least the dressing was in a separate container). Probably won't order the special again, just to avoid the salad. The rice was perfect, the sauce was delicious and the chicken was fantastic. Thinly sliced (not in chunks like all the other joints) and no yucky gristle or fat hanging off. If anything, maybe a little too heavy on the soy sauce. The spring rolls were just a tad under cooked, but still good. The sweet & sour sauce looked kinda grainy, but tasted just fine. Sunomono was great. Overall, the best teriyaki bowl in the area!  I picked up our food in the middle of lunch time and was expecting parking to be terrible, based on other reviews. But there were only a couple other cars in their small lot. There were 25-30 people scattered around the inside & outside tables, so I'm guessing they either foot it, or take the light rail, which stops just out front. Also, they have a drive up window. I'm not sure if you can order it there or if it's just for pickup, but it'd be convenient with a phone-in order next time! The staff was SUPER friendly, to boot!   P.S. They accept Visa & Mastercard, but not AmEx or Discover.

WDdc0uZPj0D9rdNDLV1VSw.text: I had really high hopes for this place due to the reviews and honestly the customer service was so wonderful I don't want to say anything negative about the place. But my teriyaki bowl was just OK. Nothing great, kind of just there. I was really let down. I haven't tried anything else so I'm thinking maybe the other menu items are better. The lady at the counter was the epidemy of customer service. She was very sweet and accommodating and seems to truly love her job which seems uncommon in the food service industry. I'd be willing to go back and try something else just because the service was so great.

KT6BKuhaqNTAFN4uhZL4eQ.text: This place is always good and the price is just right! The Daily Special always hits the spot!

doCPDeC_OilyH0Qw3-2f8w.text: When I'm craving I'll stop by for lunch and order the chicken w/veggies (sometimes no rice) and it's always worth it.

NaVEtY-rL8-iTlPAmFjMTA.text: This place never lets me down for the food and service. It's nothing crazy fancy but food is always good and fresh. Prices are reasonable too, I like the panko chicken bowl. The owners and staff are the real reason I continue to come to this establishment over those fancy places down the road.

tJFnC7F3_uHeYuF3cMvnrg.text: I have been here 3 times now and just love it. The place is delicious, clean, and cheap. Their specialty is the chicken terryaki. I recommend getting the all white meat version ( just a bit extra ). I have had the beef bowl & the chicken bowl, these are very generous portions and have yet to be able to eat it all in one sitting.  Service is super friendly and helpful. I will be back to this place soon !

s4kNNzM9KCg0gLuX6FlPxg.text: Awesome staff! Great food at great prices! I love the chicken curry, panko chicken, teriyaki chicken and the ninja fries! Love the ninja sauce!

8bU7ZqqmKqKo3oLXEN4Y6A.text: The food was soo good. I fell in love, once I took the first bite. They have great customer service and a wonderful location. I always recommend Blue Fin, to all my family member and friends.

WGyn9PteluKEYOZVl8EWqA.text: Hands down the best teryaki in the world.  i'm really not exagerating. this place is awesome. i have been going to blue fin off an on for the past 20 years. i remember as a child going to florance crittenden after getting a teriyaki bowl with half a salad. every chance i get i drop by this place.   the teriyaki bowls are serious. not skimping on portions at all. and if you seriously off a diet, they have double meat portions. :D    i like the dark meat chicken version. drop on a heavy sprinkling of the hot powder and some black sesame seeds. OMG!!! the best in the world.  the Panko chicken is my second favorite dish. the egg rolls are great.   the owners are always great, cheerful and ready to chat you up. i was so glad to hear this place was spared the wreaking ball. i would have chained myself to the door if it came to it. inside is cute and hasn't changed..in forever. i am serious. ever.  getting to it is tricky now. and parking is just as tricky. but its worth it. SOOOO WORTH IT
